Remarkably, even when it can't see, Cloyster demonstrates exceptional aim, rarely missing its mark.
cobblemon.species.gastly.name: Gastly
cobblemon.species.gastly.desc: Gaseous and completely impalpable. Also highly dangerous— inhaling part of its poisonous body will cause one to faint instantly.
cobblemon.species.haunter.name: Haunter
cobblemon.species.haunter.desc: This frightful, malevolent spirit can glide through walls, appearing wherever it likes. According to rumor, victims of a Haunter's lick will wither to death day by day.
cobblemon.species.gengar.name: Gengar
cobblemon.species.gengar.desc: Possesses potential victims' shadows in an effort to steal away the victims' lives. If your shadow begins to laugh, you must take hold of a protective charm posthaste!
cobblemon.species.onix.name: Onix
cobblemon.species.onix.desc: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.
cobblemon.species.drowzee.name: Drowzee
cobblemon.species.drowzee.desc: If you sleep by it all the time, it will sometimes show you dreams it had eaten in the past.
cobblemon.species.hypno.name: Hypno
cobblemon.species.hypno.desc: Avoid eye contact if you come across one. It will try to put you to sleep by using its pendulum.
cobblemon.species.krabby.name: Krabby
cobblemon.species.krabby.desc: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
cobblemon.species.kingler.name: Kingler
cobblemon.species.kingler.desc: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it's not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
cobblemon.species.voltorb.name: Voltorb
cobblemon.species.voltorb.desc: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
cobblemon.species.electrode.name: Electrode
cobblemon.species.electrode.desc: The tissue on the surface of its body is curiously similar in composition to an Apricorn. When irritated, this Pokémon lets loose an electric current equal to 20 lightning bolts.
cobblemon.species.exeggcute.name: Exeggcute
cobblemon.species.exeggcute.desc: Often mistaken for a clutch of Pokémon Eggs, Exeggcute are more similar in body structure to cocoa beans. There are six "seeds" in total, they communicate and coordinate with each other using telepathy, and can reunite quickly if seperated. They use these same extrasensory powers to ward off predators.
cobblemon.species.exeggcute-alola.desc: A different breed of Exeggcute with a thicker set of outer shells to better defend against Crabrawler, this breed's main predator. They intake rainwater through the openings on their heads, which they can store and use for months at a time in case their habitat should ever pass through a prolonged period of drought.
cobblemon.species.exeggutor.name: Exeggutor
cobblemon.species.exeggutor.desc: Colloquially referred to as "The Walking Jungle", this Pokémon's three heads think independently. Though they never seem to squabble, Exeggutor often has trouble getting about from place to place when they can't decide on a single direction that they want to move in. When their brains are in sync, however, Exeggutor's combined psychic power can be devastating for any opponent to deal with.
cobblemon.species.exeggutor-alola.desc: Exeggutor are known to grow at vastly different rates depending on the amount of sunlight they get. This particular breed of Exeggutor has grown to such a monstrous size that ancient recessive genes seemed to awaken upon evolving from Exeggcute, abandoning their reliance on psychic abilities and awakening the heart of a slumbering dragon.
cobblemon.species.cubone.name: Cubone
cobblemon.species.cubone.desc: This Pokémon wears the skull of its deceased mother. Sometimes Cubone's dreams make it cry, but each tear Cubone sheds makes it stronger.
cobblemon.species.marowak.name: Marowak
cobblemon.species.marowak.desc: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak's temperament also turned vicious at the same time.
cobblemon.species.hitmonlee.name: Hitmonlee
cobblemon.species.hitmonlee.desc: The legs freely contract and stretch. The stretchy legs allow it to hit a distant foe with a rising kick.
cobblemon.species.hitmonchan.name: Hitmonchan
cobblemon.species.hitmonchan.desc: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.
cobblemon.species.lickitung.name: Lickitung
cobblemon.species.lickitung.desc: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémon's viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.
cobblemon.species.koffing.name: Koffing
cobblemon.species.koffing.desc: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
cobblemon.species.weezing.name: Weezing
cobblemon.species.weezing.desc: It can't suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.
cobblemon.species.rhyhorn.name: Rhyhorn
cobblemon.species.rhyhorn.desc: Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.
cobblemon.species.rhydon.name: Rhydon
cobblemon.species.rhydon.desc: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava's heat by its tough, armorlike hide.
cobblemon.species.chansey.name: Chansey
cobblemon.species.chansey.desc: This purehearted Pokémon shares its eggs with the injured.
cobblemon.species.tangela.name: Tangela
cobblemon.species.tangela.desc: The thick vines that wrap around Tangela's body shake as it walks, giving it the appearance of a walking blue bush. Despite their bulk, the vines are very brittle and break easily, but this allows it to escape should its vines get caught on anything. When it lays down to sleep, it takes on an appearance similar to a sweet berry bush. It becomes very annoyed if it wakes up to find foxes digging through its vines for berries.
cobblemon.species.kangaskhan.name: Kangaskhan
cobblemon.species.kangaskhan.desc: Powerfully built and covered in thick armored plating, Kangaskhan is a force to be reckoned with, especially when protecting its young. It raises its child in a special pouch, keeping it warm and safe from predators. Although the juvenile must eventually set out into the world to have its own children, the act of a baby Kangaskhan actually leaving its mother's pouch is undocumented.
cobblemon.species.horsea.name: Horsea
cobblemon.species.horsea.desc: Horsea has poor endurance and is only capable of swimming in short bursts, so it clings to bits of kelp or coral to keep itself from being swept away by the current. If threatened by a predator, it shoots a stream of ink and escapes while the target is blinded. It is highly skilled with these shots, and can also use them to knock small bug Pokémon out of the air to eat.
cobblemon.species.seadra.name: Seadra
cobblemon.species.seadra.desc: Unlike Horsea, few predators are willing to threaten Seadra. Its fins are tipped with venomous spines, and it can spew water from its snout at incredibly high pressure. They are very attentive fathers, with males caring for their eggs and protecting the young after they hatch.
cobblemon.species.goldeen.name: Goldeen
cobblemon.species.goldeen.desc: This Pokémon's long, billowing fins float elegantly behind it in the water, giving Goldeen the nickname of "the water dancer." This beauty attracts mates, but also attracts unwanted attention from rivals and predators. Goldeen may look dainty, but it's not afraid to fight back using its sharp horn.
cobblemon.species.seaking.name: Seaking
cobblemon.species.seaking.desc: Despite their elegant appearances, Seaking are in fact powerful swimmers, and have been observed swimming against strong streams and currents to reach the river basin they were spawned from. When they reach these calm waters, the male uses its beautiful fins in courtship dances, and the horn on its head to bore out nests in the riverbed. Researchers are fiercely divisive on whether the horns or the fins are what attract a female Seaking.
cobblemon.species.staryu.name: Staryu
cobblemon.species.staryu.desc: If you see red lights blinking across the shoreline at night, you've found a group of Staryu. These strange Pokémon possess impressive regenerative abilities, capable of growing back entire limbs if they are torn off in battle. Studies have found that these abilities stem from the glowing core in the center of its body, which it flashes towards the sky during the night. Rumors state that it does this to communicate with the stars, but what for?
cobblemon.species.starmie.name: Starmie
cobblemon.species.starmie.desc: The mysteries surrounding this Pokémon only compound upon evolution. Starmie's "core" glows in several colors, and it seems to communicate with others of its kind by flashing patterns of colors in rapid succession. By using the psychic power stored in this gem, it can spin its body like a windmill and jettison itself through both water and air.
cobblemon.species.mrmime.name: Mr. Mime
cobblemon.species.mrmime.desc: The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.
cobblemon.species.scyther.name: Scyther
cobblemon.species.scyther.desc: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.
cobblemon.species.jynx.name: Jynx
cobblemon.species.jynx.desc: The Jynx of Galar often have beautiful and delicate voices. Some of these Pokémon have even gathered a fan base.
cobblemon.species.electabuzz.name: Electabuzz
cobblemon.species.electabuzz.desc: Feeds on electrical energy. During sudden showers beneath looming thunderclouds, one can observe Electabuzz scaling tall trees, where the Pokémon will then wait for lightning to strike.
cobblemon.species.magmar.name: Magmar
cobblemon.species.magmar.desc: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.
cobblemon.species.pinsir.name: Pinsir
cobblemon.species.pinsir.desc: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.
cobblemon.species.tauros.name: Tauros
cobblemon.species.tauros.desc: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won't allow people to ride on their backs.
cobblemon.species.magikarp.name: Magikarp
cobblemon.species.magikarp.desc: Whilst weak and pathetic in battle, Magikarp are heavily sought-after in certain high society groups. Their rare varieties of colors and patterns each have their own symbolism and meanings to aficionados of the species, and they all fetch a high price on the market.
cobblemon.species.gyarados.name: Gyarados
cobblemon.species.gyarados.desc: Every Gyarados starts its life as a pitiful Magikarp, fighting for survival in the wild. The sudden transformation from flopping prey to colossal force of destruction causes their brains to go berserk; after evolving, Gyarados crave little more than destruction and ash.
cobblemon.species.lapras.name: Lapras
cobblemon.species.lapras.desc: Schools of these gentle Pokémon travel to tropical waters to mate and raise their young before returning to the glacial seas where they make their homes. Lapras are highly intelligent, and their calls are believed to be a complex form of communication. Due to their docile nature, they are often used as transportation in coastal settlements.
cobblemon.species.ditto.name: Ditto
cobblemon.species.ditto.desc: A peculiar species, Ditto are capable of rapidly reconstituting their body structure to mimic that of anything they can see. Studies conclude that certain specimens excel in specific aspects of transformation, while others fall short in some areas, as every Ditto is unique in their own way. This transformation ability is not limited to Pokémon; some individuals have been observed to mimic nearby blocks to camouflage while sleeping. However, if Ditto attempt to mimic something from memory, or while laughing, the duplicate will have certain details incorrect or omitted entirely.
cobblemon.species.eevee.name: Eevee
cobblemon.species.eevee.desc: Harbors the potential to evolve into manifold forms. Within Eevee lies the key to the mysteries of Pokémon evolution—I'm certain of it.
cobblemon.species.vaporeon.name: Vaporeon
cobblemon.species.vaporeon.desc: Tests show that its cells closely resemble water molecules, which perhaps explains its ability to conceal its form while submerged. I believe the origins of mermaid folklore lie with this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.jolteon.name: Jolteon
cobblemon.species.jolteon.desc: Bristles its fur into sharp, needlelike points when enraged. One can hear electricity crackle in its breath when it exhales.
cobblemon.species.flareon.name: Flareon
cobblemon.species.flareon.desc: Flames burn within a saclike organ inside this Pokémon. When Flareon inhales, these flames grow in intensity, reaching a mighty 3,000 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.porygon.name: Porygon
cobblemon.species.porygon.desc: This Pokémon is strange, to say the least. Evidently it isn't natural, as it has no need for air or food. While this makes Porygon a prime candidate for exploration of some of this world's extra-ordinary locations, it would be wise to gain a better understanding of the Pokémon beforehand. There are distinct similarities between it and PC technology, but their relationship is, as of yet, unknown.
cobblemon.species.omanyte.name: Omanyte
cobblemon.species.omanyte.desc: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it's just drifting along.
cobblemon.species.omastar.name: Omastar
cobblemon.species.omastar.desc: Omastar's sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.
cobblemon.species.kabuto.name: Kabuto
cobblemon.species.kabuto.desc: While some say this species has gone extinct, Kabuto sightings are apparently fairly common in some places.
cobblemon.species.kabutops.name: Kabutops
cobblemon.species.kabutops.desc: The cause behind the extinction of this species is unknown. Kabutops were aggressive Pokémon that inhabited warm seas.
cobblemon.species.aerodactyl.name: Aerodactyl
cobblemon.species.aerodactyl.desc: Aerodactyl's sawlike fangs can shred skin to tatters—even the skin of Steel-type Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.snorlax.name: Snorlax
cobblemon.species.snorlax.desc: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.
cobblemon.species.articuno.name: Articuno
cobblemon.species.articuno.desc: This Pokémon can control ice at will. Articuno is said to live in snowy mountains riddled with permafrost.
cobblemon.species.zapdos.name: Zapdos
cobblemon.species.zapdos.desc: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It's said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.
cobblemon.species.moltres.name: Moltres
cobblemon.species.moltres.desc: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.
cobblemon.species.dratini.name: Dratini
cobblemon.species.dratini.desc: This Pokémon was long considered to be no more than a myth. The small lump on a Dratini's forehead is actually a horn that's still coming in.
cobblemon.species.dragonair.name: Dragonair
cobblemon.species.dragonair.desc: This Pokémon gathers power in the orbs on its tail and controls the weather. When enshrouded by an aura, Dragonair has a mystical appearance.
cobblemon.species.dragonite.name: Dragonite
cobblemon.species.dragonite.desc: This Pokémon is known as the Sea Incarnate. Figureheads that resemble Dragonite decorate the bows of many ships.
cobblemon.species.mewtwo.name: Mewtwo
cobblemon.species.mewtwo.desc: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew's. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
cobblemon.species.mew.name: Mew
cobblemon.species.mew.desc: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon's short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
cobblemon.species.chikorita.name: Chikorita
cobblemon.species.chikorita.desc: In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.
cobblemon.species.bayleef.name: Bayleef
cobblemon.species.bayleef.desc: Bayleef's neck is ringed by curled-up leaves. Inside each tubular leaf is a small shoot of a tree. The fragrance of this shoot makes people peppy.
cobblemon.species.meganium.name: Meganium
cobblemon.species.meganium.desc: The fragrance of Meganium's flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe's fighting spirit.
cobblemon.species.cyndaquil.name: Cyndaquil
cobblemon.species.cyndaquil.desc: Hails from the Johto region. Though usually curled into a ball due to its timid disposition, it harbors tremendous firepower.
cobblemon.species.quilava.name: Quilava
cobblemon.species.quilava.desc: This creature's fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.
cobblemon.species.typhlosion.name: Typhlosion
cobblemon.species.typhlosion.desc: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.
cobblemon.species.totodile.name: Totodile
cobblemon.species.totodile.desc: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile's jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
cobblemon.species.croconaw.name: Croconaw
cobblemon.species.croconaw.desc: Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.
cobblemon.species.feraligatr.name: Feraligatr
cobblemon.species.feraligatr.desc: Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
cobblemon.species.sentret.name: Sentret
cobblemon.species.sentret.desc: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
cobblemon.species.furret.name: Furret
cobblemon.species.furret.desc: Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
cobblemon.species.hoothoot.name: Hoothoot
cobblemon.species.hoothoot.desc: It begins to hoot at the same time every day. Some Trainers use them in place of clocks.
cobblemon.species.noctowl.name: Noctowl
cobblemon.species.noctowl.desc: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
cobblemon.species.ledyba.name: Ledyba
cobblemon.species.ledyba.desc: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.
cobblemon.species.ledian.name: Ledian
cobblemon.species.ledian.desc: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.
cobblemon.species.spinarak.name: Spinarak
cobblemon.species.spinarak.desc: Although the poison from its fangs isn't that strong, it's potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.
cobblemon.species.ariados.name: Ariados
cobblemon.species.ariados.desc: It spews threads from its mouth to catch its prey. When night falls, it leaves its web to go hunt aggressively.
cobblemon.species.crobat.name: Crobat
cobblemon.species.crobat.desc: Its hind limbs have become another set of wings. Crobat expertly maneuvers its four wings to dart in exquisite fashion through even the most confined caves without losing any speed.
cobblemon.species.chinchou.name: Chinchou
cobblemon.species.chinchou.desc: On the dark ocean floor, its only means of communication is its constantly flashing lights.
cobblemon.species.lanturn.name: Lanturn
cobblemon.species.lanturn.desc: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
cobblemon.species.pichu.name: Pichu
cobblemon.species.pichu.desc: While Pichu are in possession of impressive electrical power, they have yet to learn how to control it and tend to shock themselves as much as their opponents. Interestingly, groups of Pichu have been seen intentionally triggering these discharges by touching tails, creating a shower of sparks in the process. Researchers believe this is an attempt to gain more mastery over their abilities.
cobblemon.species.cleffa.name: Cleffa
cobblemon.species.cleffa.desc: In silhouette, they resemble twinkling starlight. When shooting stars rain from the night sky, Cleffa gather in numbers and dance as though they are indeed incarnations of the stars.
cobblemon.species.igglybuff.name: Igglybuff
cobblemon.species.igglybuff.desc: Taking advantage of the softness of its body, Igglybuff moves as if bouncing. Its body turns a deep pink when its temperature rises.
cobblemon.species.togepi.name: Togepi
cobblemon.species.togepi.desc: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.
cobblemon.species.togetic.name: Togetic
cobblemon.species.togetic.desc: No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human companion, upon whom the Pokémon then bestows great joy.
cobblemon.species.natu.name: Natu
cobblemon.species.natu.desc: Natu's wings aren't yet developed enough for it to fly, so it wanders under trees where other Pokémon live, hoping that their movement will cause fruit to fall for it to eat. Although this position puts it at risk of being confronted by ground predators, it has quite an effective trick for warding off enemies; its eerie gaze. Anything that locks eyes with Natu is overcome with an intense feeling of dread and anxiety, often causing them to flee.
cobblemon.species.xatu.name: Xatu
cobblemon.species.xatu.desc: Aside from its eyes restlessly following the sun, Xatu stands motionless for most of the day. Some "theorists" postulate that this activity is what gives Xatu its precognition. They claim that the sun shares its knowledge of the future with Xatu, and that its emotionless expression is due to how macabre the fate of our world appears to be. Many attempts have been made to discover the secrets seen by this mysterious Pokémon, but no matter the strength of the psychic, its mind seems impenetrable.
cobblemon.species.mareep.name: Mareep
cobblemon.species.mareep.desc: This common Pokémon is often found grazing in fields and meadows. Mareep regrows its coat quickly when shorn, making it a useful source of wool. It uses this wool to build up small amounts of static electricity for its tail, which it uses to communicate with other Mareep.
cobblemon.species.flaaffy.name: Flaaffy
cobblemon.species.flaaffy.desc: Flaaffy's skin has grown thick and rubbery to insulate it from its own electrical discharge. Its wool is much more sparse than that of Mareep, but the static electricity it builds up is much more powerful, making it dangerous to handle. As well, it is now notably more clever than Mareep, using the light on its tail to guide its flock.
cobblemon.species.ampharos.name: Ampharos
cobblemon.species.ampharos.desc: Ampharos has lost the ability to grow wool, and its potent electricity is now stored throughout its body. This causes the light on its tail to be incredibly bright, and it is oftentimes used as a beacon to guide ships to shore. Thankfully, Ampharos has much more control over its power now, but touching the orb at the end of its tail is still discouraged, as the discharge can easily knock even a grown Copperajah off its feet.
cobblemon.species.bellossom.name: Bellossom
cobblemon.species.bellossom.desc: Unlike the nocturnal Vileplume, Bellossom love to dance and bask in the warm sunlight. They often leave the forests they were born in to search for groups of other Bellossom to dance and frolic with. Gloom with particularly wretched odors have been noted to evolve into Bellossom with more vibrant and lustrous flowers.
cobblemon.species.marill.name: Marill
cobblemon.species.marill.desc: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That's why this Pokémon is never cold.
cobblemon.species.azumarill.name: Azumarill
cobblemon.species.azumarill.desc: These Pokémon create air-filled bubbles. When Azurill play in rivers, Azumarill will cover them with these bubbles.
cobblemon.species.sudowoodo.name: Sudowoodo
cobblemon.species.sudowoodo.desc: A cunning Pokémon that mimics a tree, despite being comprised of a more rock-like substance. Due to its Rock-typing, this behavior is theorized to exist to dissuade Water-types and lure in Bug-types for advantageous battles. The only flaw in Sudowoodo's master plan is its weakness to water. If any generous trainer approaches it with a watering can in hand, it will immediately abandon its masquerade and flee.
cobblemon.species.politoed.name: Politoed
cobblemon.species.politoed.desc: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.
cobblemon.species.hoppip.name: Hoppip
cobblemon.species.hoppip.desc: This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.
cobblemon.species.skiploom.name: Skiploom
cobblemon.species.skiploom.desc: Skiploom's flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.
cobblemon.species.jumpluff.name: Jumpluff
cobblemon.species.jumpluff.desc: Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
cobblemon.species.aipom.name: Aipom
cobblemon.species.aipom.desc: The hand-shaped appendage on Aipom's tail is made up of dense muscle fibers, allowing it to perform all kinds of different tasks; jumping from branch to branch, picking berries, delivering attacks, etc. Some Aipom have even been seen giving each other handshakes with their tails. With this versatile tool at its disposal, its real hands are rarely used, and they end up serving more as a temporary replacement just in case its tail needs time to recover from an injury.
cobblemon.species.sunkern.name: Sunkern
cobblemon.species.sunkern.desc: Sunkern subsists on morning dewdrops that form on low-lying foliage. To conserve energy until its evolution, it moves very little and relies on a unique defense: if threatened, this fragile Pokémon will shake violently in hopes of scaring off attackers. Its bright, summery yellow hue is thought to be the origin of an old wives' tale, claiming that newborn Sunkern fall from the sky like drops of sunshine.
cobblemon.species.sunflora.name: Sunflora
cobblemon.species.sunflora.desc: Like many Grass-type Pokémon, Sunflora generates energy through photosynthesis, converting sunlight into nutrients. Throughout the day, it energetically rushes from place to place, fanning its petals and leaves in hopes to absorb as much sunlight as possible. When night falls, Sunflora stops moving entirely, conserving the nutrients it's created. These behaviors make it highly efficient at gathering and storing solar energy.
cobblemon.species.yanma.name: Yanma
cobblemon.species.yanma.desc: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.
cobblemon.species.wooper.name: Wooper
cobblemon.species.wooper.desc: This playful Pokémon enjoys splashing around in the muddy waters of its habitat, sociable to not only its own kind but to other Pokémon and humans as well. Unfortunately, it doesn't know that the membrane that keeps its body moist on land contains a weak numbing toxin. If you pat a Wooper on the head, you may be unable to feel your hand for the next few hours.
cobblemon.species.wooper-paldea.desc: This playful Pokémon enjoys splashing around in the muddy waters of its habitat, sociable to not only its own kind but to other Pokémon and humans as well. Unfortunately, it doesn't know that the membrane that keeps its body moist on land contains a weak numbing toxin. If you pat a Wooper on the head, you may be unable to feel your hand for the next few hours.
cobblemon.species.quagsire.name: Quagsire
cobblemon.species.quagsire.desc: Quagsire often find themselves tangled within the twisting roots of mangrove trees as they swim, but thanks to their absentminded personalities, they don't thrash or struggle. Instead, they're able to calmly slip their slimy bodies through the roots. In fact, this Pokémon is so aloof that it is completely oblivious to others riding on its back, but it is nonetheless happy to transport these friends across shallow waters.
cobblemon.species.espeon.name: Espeon
cobblemon.species.espeon.desc: Wields an arcane power with which it can predict the weather and even people's thoughts. When bathed in sunshine, the scarlet orb on its brow glows and builds energy.
cobblemon.species.umbreon.name: Umbreon
cobblemon.species.umbreon.desc: It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and perceive prey with absolute clarity.
cobblemon.species.murkrow.name: Murkrow
cobblemon.species.murkrow.desc: Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths with this creature, I've been told one must chant ”Workrum, Workrum—bad luck, don't come” as a protective incantation.
cobblemon.species.slowking.name: Slowking
cobblemon.species.slowking.desc: Slowking receives a stimulant injected directly into its brain by the Shellder clamped onto its head, resulting in a remarkable boost in intellect and intuition. Some Slowbro even gather to follow it as servants, drawn by its cool confidence and strategic wisdom in difficult situations. The only thing that disrupts its composure is losing an intellectual challenge—a rare occurrence, of course.
cobblemon.species.misdreavus.name: Misdreavus
cobblemon.species.misdreavus.desc: Misdreavus loves to frighten children by releasing blood-curdling shrieks and sobs into the dead of night, feasting on the fear it creates by doing so. Its hauntings have become so frequent that some people even report seeing its eerie hair in their nightmares.
cobblemon.species.unown.name: Unown
cobblemon.species.unown.desc: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I've pointed out that the species' many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.
cobblemon.species.wobbuffet.name: Wobbuffet
cobblemon.species.wobbuffet.desc: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
cobblemon.species.girafarig.name: Girafarig
cobblemon.species.girafarig.desc: Girafarig's rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn't need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
cobblemon.species.pineco.name: Pineco
cobblemon.species.pineco.desc: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.
cobblemon.species.forretress.name: Forretress
cobblemon.species.forretress.desc: In the moment that it gulps down its prey, the inside of its shell is exposed, but to this day, no one has ever seen that sight.
cobblemon.species.dunsparce.name: Dunsparce
cobblemon.species.dunsparce.desc: The nests Dunsparce live in are mazes of tunnels. They never get lost in their own nests—they can tell where they are by the scent of the dirt.
cobblemon.species.gligar.name: Gligar
cobblemon.species.gligar.desc: Its tail is tipped by a thick, horrible stinger. To bring down prey, it will first obscure their vision by covering their faces with its body, and then it will use the stinger to inject them with venom.
cobblemon.species.steelix.name: Steelix
cobblemon.species.steelix.desc: This Pokémon evolved through use of a strange item. Its body is coated with steel powder and notably hard—not even diamond can leave so much as a scratch.
cobblemon.species.snubbull.name: Snubbull
cobblemon.species.snubbull.desc: In contrast to its appearance, it's quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.
cobblemon.species.granbull.name: Granbull
cobblemon.species.granbull.desc: Although it's popular with young people, Granbull is timid and sensitive, so it's totally incompetent as a watchdog.
cobblemon.species.qwilfish.name: Qwilfish
cobblemon.species.qwilfish.desc: These spiny Pokémon are found in warm waters, armed with dangerous venom spines that they can fire like arrows to dissuade any would-be predators. They are often found in and around Ocean Monuments, and are notably unbothered by Guardians. This could perhaps be due to similarities in their behavior and physiology.
cobblemon.species.qwilfish-hisui.desc: Living in colder waters seems to have caused Qwilfish to undergo biological changes. It collects poison from the food it eats and pumps it all into its thick venomous spines for later use. Compared to their tropical relatives, these Pokémon are known to be even more ill-tempered, garnering them an unfavorable reputation among anglers.
cobblemon.species.scizor.name: Scizor
cobblemon.species.scizor.desc: Evolved by way of a curious item. The shell covering its body has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.
cobblemon.species.shuckle.name: Shuckle
cobblemon.species.shuckle.desc: When threatened, Shuckle hides beneath rocks and remains completely still, capable of surviving for years without eating. Inside its shell, natural processes allow it to ferment and recycle food efficiently, producing a berry juice believed to boost vitality and cure ailments. As Shuckle ages, its shell grows stronger, leading to tales of ancient Shuckle whose shells became nearly impenetrable.
cobblemon.species.heracross.name: Heracross
cobblemon.species.heracross.desc: Male specimens often dispute with each other over territory or potential mates. These disputes are settled by a direct clash of horns, hands, strength, and technique; the moment one is flipped onto its back, the conflict is decided. Despite this occasional rivalry, Heracross are generally peaceful, and they even use their horns to protect other Bug Pokémon from predators. The ones under their guard often establish a symbiotic relationship with them, repaying their protection by offering Heracross some honey, their favorite treat.
cobblemon.species.sneasel.name: Sneasel
cobblemon.species.sneasel.desc: A sly Pokémon that lives off ill-gotten gains, Sneasel uses its sharp, curved claws to access nests high in trees or just beneath the soil. Often working in pairs, one Sneasel lures a Pokémon from its nest while the other snatches anything it deems valuable. It's not uncommon for Sneasel to steal food, shiny objects, or other treasures, making it a master of mischief
cobblemon.species.sneasel-hisui.desc: This form of Sneasel has adapted to perilous cliffs, using its hooked claws to scale the mountainsides. Unlike its devious Dark-type counterpart, it and its pack prefer direct attacks on their prey. Don’t mistake its lack of craftiness for docility, however—the special venom secreted from its claws can damage the nerves of anything they slash.
cobblemon.species.teddiursa.name: Teddiursa
cobblemon.species.teddiursa.desc: It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.
cobblemon.species.ursaring.name: Ursaring
cobblemon.species.ursaring.desc: When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokémon will wander fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries. Ursaring's hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.
cobblemon.species.slugma.name: Slugma
cobblemon.species.slugma.desc: The thick gel that makes up Slugma’s body is similar to magma cream, allowing it to maintain its molten form and incredibly high body temperatures. Slugma can only survive near intense heat sources, like the vast, burning seas of the Nether, as its body quickly solidifies in cooler environments.
cobblemon.species.magcargo.name: Magcargo
cobblemon.species.magcargo.desc: Magcargo’s "shell" is actually part of its body that has solidified into brittle stone. It uses this rocky armor to defend itself, though large chunks often break off during battles. However, this doesn’t bother Magcargo—after battle it simply bathes in molten magma to regenerate its protective shell..
cobblemon.species.swinub.name: Swinub
cobblemon.species.swinub.desc: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.
cobblemon.species.piloswine.name: Piloswine
cobblemon.species.piloswine.desc: The long fur of this Pokémon covers its eyes, ears, and even limbs, allowing Piloswine to resist harshly frigid conditions. The Pokémon's white tusks can be used to defeat its enemies.
cobblemon.species.corsola.name: Corsola
cobblemon.species.corsola.desc: These Pokémon live in warm seas. In prehistoric times, many lived in the oceans around the Galar region as well.
cobblemon.species.remoraid.name: Remoraid
cobblemon.species.remoraid.desc: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.
cobblemon.species.octillery.name: Octillery
cobblemon.species.octillery.desc: While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.
cobblemon.species.delibird.name: Delibird
cobblemon.species.delibird.desc: It has a generous habit of sharing its food with people and Pokémon, so it's always scrounging around for more food.
cobblemon.species.mantine.name: Mantine
cobblemon.species.mantine.desc: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.
cobblemon.species.skarmory.name: Skarmory
cobblemon.species.skarmory.desc: People fashion swords from Skarmory's shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.
cobblemon.species.houndour.name: Houndour
cobblemon.species.houndour.desc: They make repeated eerie howls before dawn to call attention to their pack.
cobblemon.species.houndoom.name: Houndoom
cobblemon.species.houndoom.desc: Identifiable by its eerie howls, people a long time ago thought it was the grim reaper and feared it.
cobblemon.species.kingdra.name: Kingdra
cobblemon.species.kingdra.desc: According to legends, only Seadra that have lived a hundred years can evolve into the powerful Kingdra. Although it is capable of besting almost any foe, it spends its time in solitude in the deepest parts of the ocean. It can control the ocean currents at a whim, and sailors make offerings to it before long voyages.
cobblemon.species.phanpy.name: Phanpy
cobblemon.species.phanpy.desc: Phanpy use their extremely dexterous trunks for nearly everything, from expressing emotions to washing themselves. Groups of Phanpy can be found near shallow ponds, spraying each other with the water gathered in their trunks and playing in the mud. Unfortunately, they're much stronger than they appear. When overwhelmed with joy, their reckless flailing will knock back anything that gets too close.
cobblemon.species.donphan.name: Donphan
cobblemon.species.donphan.desc: The larger this Pokémon's tusks are, the more respect it is given by other Donphan. When provoked, it can use these tusks to deliver blows that can easily demolish houses. However, if it's particularly enraged, it will roll up into a ball and launch itself at its foe. Occasionally, this will cause one of its tusks to come loose and fall off. Fortunately, Donphan's tusks regrow over time, and they have a variety of construction applications when collected.
cobblemon.species.porygon2.name: Porygon2
cobblemon.species.porygon2.desc: With its evolution induced by an object of equal curiosity, Porygon2 seems more... realistic than its predecesor? Certainly the rough edges have been polished, and it seems to display higher levels of conciousness and mobility. Still, it has no need for food or breath, and the prospect of using it to explore previously unreachable domains is alluring. Perhaps one more "upgrade" will do?
cobblemon.species.stantler.name: Stantler
cobblemon.species.stantler.desc: Ancient records suggest that Stantler once possessed great psychic powers, but the absence of predators in its habitat led to these abilities being neglected and ultimately lost. However, a remnant of its past self lingers, particularly in its antlers. Gazing at them induces hypnotic sensations, capable of locking a victim's gaze until they faint. Contrary to popular belief, this effect is activated consciously, meaning the species is not as defenseless as many have speculated.
cobblemon.species.smeargle.name: Smeargle
cobblemon.species.smeargle.desc: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.
cobblemon.species.tyrogue.name: Tyrogue
cobblemon.species.tyrogue.desc: Even though it is small, it can't be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.
cobblemon.species.hitmontop.name: Hitmontop
cobblemon.species.hitmontop.desc: After doing a handstand to throw off the opponent's timing, it presents its fancy kick moves.
cobblemon.species.smoochum.name: Smoochum
cobblemon.species.smoochum.desc: This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum decides what it likes and dislikes by touching things with its lips.
cobblemon.species.elekid.name: Elekid
cobblemon.species.elekid.desc: They generate electricity by spinning their arms. During a thunderstorm, if one hears the lively voices of children out in the wilderness, what one is actually hearing are the voices of Elekid.
cobblemon.species.magby.name: Magby
cobblemon.species.magby.desc: This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.
cobblemon.species.miltank.name: Miltank
cobblemon.species.miltank.desc: A healthy Miltank can easily produce multiple buckets of milk in a day. This Pokémon is a favorite among alchemists and explorers, as its nutritious milk can nullify the adverse effects of any nasty potion they may encounter. Miltank is especially popular with adventurous types, as it packs more punch than it may seem. With a single Rollout attack, it can turn fallen debris into splinters, clearing the path forwards.
cobblemon.species.blissey.name: Blissey
cobblemon.species.blissey.desc: A kindhearted Pokémon that will care for any sick person or Pokémon until their health improves. The eggs it lays are delicious and bring good fortune to those who eat them.
cobblemon.species.raikou.name: Raikou
cobblemon.species.raikou.desc: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
cobblemon.species.entei.name: Entei
cobblemon.species.entei.desc: Entei embodies the passion of magma. This Pokémon is thought to have been born in the eruption of a volcano. It sends up massive bursts of fire that utterly consume all that they touch.
cobblemon.species.suicune.name: Suicune
cobblemon.species.suicune.desc: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.
cobblemon.species.larvitar.name: Larvitar
cobblemon.species.larvitar.desc: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
cobblemon.species.pupitar.name: Pupitar
cobblemon.species.pupitar.desc: It will not stay still, even while it's a pupa. It already has arms and legs under its solid shell.
cobblemon.species.tyranitar.name: Tyranitar
cobblemon.species.tyranitar.desc: The quakes caused when it walks make even great mountains crumble and change the surrounding terrain.
cobblemon.species.lugia.name: Lugia
cobblemon.species.lugia.desc: Lugia's wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
cobblemon.species.hooh.name: Ho-Oh
cobblemon.species.hooh.desc: Ho-Oh's feathers glow in seven colors depending on the angle at which they are struck by light. These feathers are said to bring happiness to the bearers. This Pokémon is said to live at the foot of a rainbow.
cobblemon.species.celebi.name: Celebi
cobblemon.species.celebi.desc: This Pokémon traveled through time to come from the future. It bolsters grass and trees with its own strength, and it can heal wounds, too.
cobblemon.species.treecko.name: Treecko
cobblemon.species.treecko.desc: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.
cobblemon.species.grovyle.name: Grovyle
cobblemon.species.grovyle.desc: This Pokémon adeptly flies from branch to branch in trees. In a forest, no Pokémon can ever hope to catch a fleeing Grovyle however fast they may be.
cobblemon.species.sceptile.name: Sceptile
cobblemon.species.sceptile.desc: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.
cobblemon.species.torchic.name: Torchic
cobblemon.species.torchic.desc: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
cobblemon.species.combusken.name: Combusken
cobblemon.species.combusken.desc: Combusken battles with the intensely hot flames it spews from its beak and with outstandingly destructive kicks. This Pokémon's cry is very loud and distracting.
cobblemon.species.blaziken.name: Blaziken
cobblemon.species.blaziken.desc: Blaziken has incredibly strong legs—it can easily clear a 30-story building in one leap. This Pokémon's blazing punches leave its foes scorched and blackened.
cobblemon.species.mudkip.name: Mudkip
cobblemon.species.mudkip.desc: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
cobblemon.species.marshtomp.name: Marshtomp
cobblemon.species.marshtomp.desc: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon's hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.
cobblemon.species.swampert.name: Swampert
cobblemon.species.swampert.desc: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.
cobblemon.species.poochyena.name: Poochyena
cobblemon.species.poochyena.desc: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.
cobblemon.species.mightyena.name: Mightyena
cobblemon.species.mightyena.desc: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.
cobblemon.species.zigzagoon.name: Zigzagoon
cobblemon.species.zigzagoon.desc: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you've lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.
cobblemon.species.linoone.name: Linoone
cobblemon.species.linoone.desc: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.
cobblemon.species.wurmple.name: Wurmple
cobblemon.species.wurmple.desc: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.
cobblemon.species.silcoon.name: Silcoon
cobblemon.species.silcoon.desc: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can't extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.
cobblemon.species.beautifly.name: Beautifly
cobblemon.species.beautifly.desc: A colorful and incredibly beautiful but also greedy Pokémon. In an effort to keep its favorite food all to itself, it will chase away Combee as they try to gather nectar.
cobblemon.species.cascoon.name: Cascoon
cobblemon.species.cascoon.desc: The silk coating its body is thin but sufficiently strong. Cascoon's silk has a luster and texture superior to that of Silcoon's, and clothes made using Cascoon silk are regarded as top-notch.
cobblemon.species.dustox.name: Dustox
cobblemon.species.dustox.desc: Tends to be drawn to bonfires on dark nights. Difficult to chase away from settlements because of the way it scatters highly toxic scales.
cobblemon.species.lotad.name: Lotad
cobblemon.species.lotad.desc: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.
cobblemon.species.lombre.name: Lombre
cobblemon.species.lombre.desc: It lives at the water's edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.
cobblemon.species.ludicolo.name: Ludicolo
cobblemon.species.ludicolo.desc: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.
cobblemon.species.seedot.name: Seedot
cobblemon.species.seedot.desc: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
cobblemon.species.nuzleaf.name: Nuzleaf
cobblemon.species.nuzleaf.desc: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf's grass flute fills listeners with dread.
cobblemon.species.shiftry.name: Shiftry
cobblemon.species.shiftry.desc: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.
cobblemon.species.taillow.name: Taillow
cobblemon.species.taillow.desc: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
cobblemon.species.swellow.name: Swellow
cobblemon.species.swellow.desc: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other's wings.
cobblemon.species.wingull.name: Wingull
cobblemon.species.wingull.desc: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea's edge.
cobblemon.species.pelipper.name: Pelipper
cobblemon.species.pelipper.desc: Skimming the water's surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.
cobblemon.species.ralts.name: Ralts
cobblemon.species.ralts.desc: The horn on its head is able to attune itself to the emotions of humans around it, but Ralts has yet to learn how to control this ability. As a result, it unintentionally reflects and amplifies these emotions; if it's around happy people, Ralts will be joyous, but if it's around gloomy people, it will become miserable. Because of this, it will often hide away from humans, only approaching if it senses positivity.
cobblemon.species.kirlia.name: Kirlia
cobblemon.species.kirlia.desc: Exposure to high amounts of positive emotion has heightened Kirlia's psychokinetic power. With a quick spin and a single dance, this Pokémon can create mirages of far-off paradises and peer into the future. Its connection to emotion was once a liability as a Ralts, but after honing its psychic capabilities, almost any emotion causes its power to grow.
cobblemon.species.gardevoir.name: Gardevoir
cobblemon.species.gardevoir.desc: Gardevoir is fiercely loyal and dedicated to protecting its Trainer, having been in sync with their emotions for so long. Should one it cares about fall in battle, Gardevoir's emotions become too much for it to bear. In a fit of rage and grief, it can expend all of its psychic energy to tear a pitch-dark hole through the dimensions. No creature - human, Pokémon, or otherwise - on the receiving end of this devastating attack has ever been found afterwards.
cobblemon.species.surskit.name: Surskit
cobblemon.species.surskit.desc: Wild Surskit usually hold a diet of whatever detritus floats on top of their ponds. However, if one is desperate enough for food, it'll seek out groups of other Surskit to drink the sticky-sweet syrup they produce from the tips of their heads.
cobblemon.species.masquerain.name: Masquerain
cobblemon.species.masquerain.desc: Masquerain are highly sensitive to the water quality and overall health of their environment, even to the point of chasing off potential polluters. Because of this, ecologists will often observe Masquerain to monitor the health of an ecosystem. If their population is high, there's nothing to worry about.
cobblemon.species.shroomish.name: Shroomish
cobblemon.species.shroomish.desc: Shroomish prefer dark, damp places, and they will sleep through the daylight hidden under forest trees or fallen leaves. Once the sun sets, they love to roam around and munch away at rotting leaves and decaying debris. When threatened, they become very anxious, and without warning, they will let out a burst of toxic spores from the bud at the top of their head.
cobblemon.species.breloom.name: Breloom
cobblemon.species.breloom.desc: When it or its kin are threatened, Breloom uses the toxic seeds on its tail to incapacitate would-be attackers. While its foes are stunned, it throws punches with its stretchy arms that would put professional boxers to shame. In the wild, it uses these punches to knock berries out of trees for itself and its kin to eat.
cobblemon.species.slakoth.name: Slakoth
cobblemon.species.slakoth.desc: Slakoth's heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.
cobblemon.species.vigoroth.name: Vigoroth
cobblemon.species.vigoroth.desc: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.
cobblemon.species.slaking.name: Slaking
cobblemon.species.slaking.desc: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.
cobblemon.species.nincada.name: Nincada
cobblemon.species.nincada.desc: Nincada spends most of its time underground, remaining almost entirely still as it waits for the moment to evolve. It thrives in the cool, damp earth, away from harsh weather that its delicate body cannot withstand. While awake, it uses its sharp claws to dig into tree roots, absorbing moisture and nutrients. However, its solitary existence leaves it vulnerable to subterranean predators, who can easily breach its insect shell defenses.
cobblemon.species.ninjask.name: Ninjask
cobblemon.species.ninjask.desc: Ninjask possesses the highest speeds ever seen in an ordinary Pokémon, sometimes moving so fast it becomes invisible. It only slows down when it's feeding on tree sap, which predators use as an opportunity to strike. However, its reaction speed is equally remarkable; the moment danger reveals itself, it hastily darts away. Some even retaliate by emitting a piercing cry that can induce severe headaches in their attackers.
cobblemon.species.shedinja.name: Shedinja
cobblemon.species.shedinja.desc: After a Nincada evolves, its discarded carapace can sometimes take on a life of its own. Shedinja’s eerie stillness stands in contrast to Ninjask’s vibrant energy. This empty shell remains completely motionless, without a single twitch, and it’s unclear whether it has any will or consciousness. It doesn’t react to stimuli and seems devoid of emotions. Those who peer into its hollow back often begin to exhibit similar signs of lifelessness.
cobblemon.species.whismur.name: Whismur
cobblemon.species.whismur.desc: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it's exhausted, then it falls asleep.
cobblemon.species.loudred.name: Loudred
cobblemon.species.loudred.desc: The force of this Pokémon's loud voice isn't just the sound—it's also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.
cobblemon.species.exploud.name: Exploud
cobblemon.species.exploud.desc: This Pokémon can do more than just shout. To communicate with others of its kind, it'll emit all sorts of sounds from the holes in its body.
cobblemon.species.makuhita.name: Makuhita
cobblemon.species.makuhita.desc: There's a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.
cobblemon.species.hariyama.name: Hariyama
cobblemon.species.hariyama.desc: Hariyama that are big and fat aren't necessarily strong. There are some small ones that move nimbly and use moves skillfully.
cobblemon.species.azurill.name: Azurill
cobblemon.species.azurill.desc: Although Azurill are normally docile, an angry one will swing around the big ball on its tail and try to smash its opponents.
cobblemon.species.nosepass.name: Nosepass
cobblemon.species.nosepass.desc: With incredibly precise magnetic senses, Nosepass instinctively direct themselves towards a specific geographic location. While the reason behind this behavior remains shrouded in mystery, travelers often use Nosepass as a guide on long journeys. However, if a Nosepass finds itself in another dimension, it will become dazed and disoriented, unable to determine its own location.ses.
cobblemon.species.skitty.name: Skitty
cobblemon.species.skitty.desc: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
cobblemon.species.delcatty.name: Delcatty
cobblemon.species.delcatty.desc: Delcatty sleeps anywhere it wants without keeping a permanent nest. If other Pokémon approach it as it sleeps, this Pokémon will never fight—it will just move away somewhere else.
cobblemon.species.sableye.name: Sableye
cobblemon.species.sableye.desc: Sableye can often be found in underground geodes to satiate their unusual diet of minerals, this strange eating habit results in their own bodies being partially comprised of gemstones, with their apparent preference for amethyst in particular contributing to their purple color. Sableye will often fight each other for dibs on the largest clusters in a geode, however, even the most territorial of Sableye will abandon everything if they spot their favorite prey - Carbink.
cobblemon.species.mawile.name: Mawile
cobblemon.species.mawile.desc: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.
cobblemon.species.aron.name: Aron
cobblemon.species.aron.desc: When Aron evolves, its steel armor peels off. In ancient times, people would collect Aron's shed armor and make good use of it in their daily lives.
cobblemon.species.lairon.name: Lairon
cobblemon.species.lairon.desc: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.
cobblemon.species.aggron.name: Aggron
cobblemon.species.aggron.desc: Long ago, there was a king who wore a helmet meant to resemble the head of an Aggron. He was trying to channel the Pokémon's strength.
cobblemon.species.meditite.name: Meditite
cobblemon.species.meditite.desc: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon's training.
cobblemon.species.medicham.name: Medicham
cobblemon.species.medicham.desc: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.
cobblemon.species.electrike.name: Electrike
cobblemon.species.electrike.desc: It stores electricity in its fur. It gives off sparks from all over its body in seasons when the air is dry.
cobblemon.species.manectric.name: Manectric
cobblemon.species.manectric.desc: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.
cobblemon.species.plusle.name: Plusle
cobblemon.species.plusle.desc: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.
cobblemon.species.minun.name: Minun
cobblemon.species.minun.desc: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
cobblemon.species.volbeat.name: Volbeat
cobblemon.species.volbeat.desc: Volbeat's tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
cobblemon.species.illumise.name: Illumise
cobblemon.species.illumise.desc: Illumise leads a flight of illuminated Volbeat to draw signs in the night sky. This Pokémon is said to earn greater respect from its peers by composing more complex designs in the sky.
cobblemon.species.roselia.name: Roselia
cobblemon.species.roselia.desc: Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.
cobblemon.species.gulpin.name: Gulpin
cobblemon.species.gulpin.desc: Most of Gulpin's body is made up of its stomach—its heart and brain are very small in comparison. This Pokémon's stomach contains special enzymes that dissolve anything.
cobblemon.species.swalot.name: Swalot
cobblemon.species.swalot.desc: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon's mouth.
cobblemon.species.carvanha.name: Carvanha
cobblemon.species.carvanha.desc: Despite this voracious Pokémon's aggressive mentality, Carvanha refuses to attack an enemy alone. It will sit and wait silently for other members of its pack to arrive, where they will proceed to mercilessly tear into their target with red, jagged fangs. While isolated individuals of this species are rather timid, packs of Carvanha will attack anything that touches the water, seemingly without any provocation. Most seasoned fishermen know to cover their wounds before setting sail, as even a single drop of blood will send a pack of Carvanha into a boat-splintering frenzy.
cobblemon.species.sharpedo.name: Sharpedo
cobblemon.species.sharpedo.desc: Sharpedo's specialized skin helps it swim at outstanding speeds, allowing it to perform almost instantaneous onslaughts. This brutal aquatic predator is known as the "Bully of the Sea," a nickname it earned with its insatiable appetite for brutality. Oftentimes, it will attack stone or metal simply because it craves violence, causing its teeth to chip and shatter. Although, its teeth grow back rapidly, allowing it to continue non-stop on its lifelong rampage. Any life in the sea could be its next target; fish, other Pokémon, Drowned, and even living humans.
cobblemon.species.wailmer.name: Wailmer
cobblemon.species.wailmer.desc: Although these Pokémon are primarily aquatic, they occasionally gather in large groups on beaches. Having filled themselves with seawater, they bounce playfully across the sand. However, Wailmer are not very skilled at controlling their bounce, and they often end up tumbling into others of their kind. This doesn’t seem to bother them though, as they are protected by a thick layer of blubber.
cobblemon.species.wailord.name: Wailord
cobblemon.species.wailord.desc: Few predators can hope to threaten this massive Pokémon, so it spends its life floating calmly beneath the waves, opening its cavernous mouth to swallow up schools of smaller Pokémon and plant debris. Wailord’s body is full of air, so it takes a lot of energy for it to stay underwater. When it's ready to return from the depths, it uses its natural buoyancy to rocket upwards, breaching the surface at incredible speeds..
cobblemon.species.numel.name: Numel
cobblemon.species.numel.desc: Numel are exceptionally hardy Pokémon found in hot, dry areas. They have even been observed herding within the wastes of the Nether, gulping down buckets worth of lava at a time to store within their humps. They are incredibly dull-witted, and it can take them several moments to even notice that they are being attacked.
cobblemon.species.camerupt.name: Camerupt
cobblemon.species.camerupt.desc: The pressure within its lava-storing humps is now so great that it is constantly at risk of erupting. However, with careful harvesting, this lava can be extracted and used in metallurgy, making Camerupt a popular Pokémon among blacksmiths. When in need of a refuel, it eats rocks and ore, melting them down using its own body heat.
cobblemon.species.torkoal.name: Torkoal
cobblemon.species.torkoal.desc: Although coal is the most plentiful mineral in the world, there is always a notable decline in its concentration around areas where Torkoal lives. This smoky Pokémon digs up the ore in mass amounts, which it burns inside its shell to provide its body with energy. This process releases thick billows of smoke, which it uses as a distraction against other Pokémon. While this intense volume of soot and vapor is irritating to most people, it seems that Torkoal loves it, maintaining a calm and serene expression when surrounded by its own smog..
cobblemon.species.spoink.name: Spoink
cobblemon.species.spoink.desc: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon's psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
cobblemon.species.grumpig.name: Grumpig
cobblemon.species.grumpig.desc: Grumpig uses the black pearls on its body to wield its fantastic powers. When it is doing so, it dances bizarrely. This Pokémon's black pearls are valuable as works of art.
cobblemon.species.spinda.name: Spinda
cobblemon.species.spinda.desc: Though their sporadic movements seem random, some claim that Spinda follow a mysterious and mesmerizing choreography. They are known to perform in the strangest places, even on the roofs of buildings or down in lost caverns, with no clear explanation of how they got there. Each Spinda has a wholly unique pattern of spots that cause their opponents to become confused when paired with their teetering pirouettes and unsteady steps. Interestingly, clothing mimicking Spinda spots appear to cause trainers to become harder to track, much like the Pokémon itself.!
cobblemon.species.trapinch.name: Trapinch
cobblemon.species.trapinch.desc: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
cobblemon.species.vibrava.name: Vibrava
cobblemon.species.vibrava.desc: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.
cobblemon.species.flygon.name: Flygon
cobblemon.species.flygon.desc: It is nicknamed the Desert Spirit because the flapping of its wings sounds like a woman singing.
cobblemon.species.cacnea.name: Cacnea
cobblemon.species.cacnea.desc: The more arid and harsh the environment, the more pretty and fragrant a flower Cacnea grows. This Pokémon battles by wildly swinging its thorny arms.
cobblemon.species.cacturne.name: Cacturne
cobblemon.species.cacturne.desc: If a traveler is going through a desert in the thick of night, Cacturne will follow in a ragtag group. The Pokémon are biding their time, waiting for the traveler to tire and become incapable of moving.
cobblemon.species.swablu.name: Swablu
cobblemon.species.swablu.desc: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.
cobblemon.species.altaria.name: Altaria
cobblemon.species.altaria.desc: This Pokémon has a kind disposition, but if it's provoked, it will threaten opponents with shrill cries before attacking them without mercy.
cobblemon.species.zangoose.name: Zangoose
cobblemon.species.zangoose.desc: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
cobblemon.species.seviper.name: Seviper
cobblemon.species.seviper.desc: Seviper's swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
cobblemon.species.lunatone.name: Lunatone
cobblemon.species.lunatone.desc: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
cobblemon.species.solrock.name: Solrock
cobblemon.species.solrock.desc: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.
cobblemon.species.barboach.name: Barboach
cobblemon.species.barboach.desc: Makes its home in swamps with murky water. The poor visibility hides this Pokémon from predators, and the slime on its body makes grasping it difficult.
cobblemon.species.whiscash.name: Whiscash
cobblemon.species.whiscash.desc: Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole. People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.
cobblemon.species.corphish.name: Corphish
cobblemon.species.corphish.desc: It was originally a Pokémon from afar that escaped to the wild. It can adapt to the dirtiest river.
cobblemon.species.crawdaunt.name: Crawdaunt
cobblemon.species.crawdaunt.desc: A brutish Pokémon that loves to battle. It will crash itself into any foe that approaches its nest.
cobblemon.species.baltoy.name: Baltoy
cobblemon.species.baltoy.desc: Illustrations found in millenia-old ruins almost always depict Baltoy interacting with humans, and especially children. Because it moves by spinning around on a single foot, it's theorized that children would play with this Pokémon as if it were a top..
cobblemon.species.claydol.name: Claydol
cobblemon.species.claydol.desc: The art on Claydol's body bears heavy remblance to pottery sherds found buried under grand temples in the desert. It's unclear what relation they have to the structure or the ancient civilization that build it, but they can still be found wandering near them to this day.
cobblemon.species.lileep.name: Lileep
cobblemon.species.lileep.desc: Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with petallike tentacles.
cobblemon.species.cradily.name: Cradily
cobblemon.species.cradily.desc: Once Cradily catches prey in its tentacles, it digests them whole and absorbs their nutrients.
cobblemon.species.anorith.name: Anorith
cobblemon.species.anorith.desc: Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings through the water like oars on a boat. This Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.armaldo.name: Armaldo
cobblemon.species.armaldo.desc: Though it lives on land, it's also a good swimmer. It dives into the ocean in search of prey, using its sharp claws to take down its quarry.
cobblemon.species.feebas.name: Feebas
cobblemon.species.feebas.desc: It is a shabby and ugly Pokémon. However, it is very hardy and can survive on little water.
cobblemon.species.milotic.name: Milotic
cobblemon.species.milotic.desc: It's said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you're feeling.
cobblemon.species.castform.name: Castform
cobblemon.species.castform.desc: Its form changes depending on the weather. The rougher conditions get, the rougher Castform's disposition!
cobblemon.species.kecleon.name: Kecleon
cobblemon.species.kecleon.desc: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.
cobblemon.species.shuppet.name: Shuppet
cobblemon.species.shuppet.desc: There's a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”
cobblemon.species.banette.name: Banette
cobblemon.species.banette.desc: Resentment at being cast off made it spring into being. Some say that treating it well will satisfy it, and it will once more become a stuffed toy.
cobblemon.species.duskull.name: Duskull
cobblemon.species.duskull.desc: Duskull's body is only semi-corporeal, allowing it to pass through any object, regardless of composition or size. It uses this ability to stay inside walls and observe prey, planning the best strategy to carry out an ambush. As it stalks through the night in search of prey, it can't help but be drawn to the cries of misbehaving children.
cobblemon.species.dusclops.name: Dusclops
cobblemon.species.dusclops.desc: There aren't many studies around this Pokémon's body, as it is capable of absorbing almost anything that strays too close. Although Dusclops mostly uses this skill as a defense and hunting mechanism, it is also believed that it consumes random pieces of buildings or land, simply because it finds it funny to leave them incomplete.
cobblemon.species.tropius.name: Tropius
cobblemon.species.tropius.desc: Fossil records indicate that this gentle giant has been roaming the jungle, both on foot and in flight, since ancient times. The fruit that grows on Tropius's neck is sweet and nutritious, and it is enjoyed by people and Pokémon alike. As the berries ripen, people gather around it to feed on them. Tropius doesn't mind this at all, as sharing its fruit helps to spread its seeds.
cobblemon.species.chimecho.name: Chimecho
cobblemon.species.chimecho.desc: Can emit waves of air powerful enough to knock out prey taller than itself. I hypothesize that it amplifies the faint sound of wind within its body.
cobblemon.species.absol.name: Absol
cobblemon.species.absol.desc: Because of this Pokémon's ability to detect danger, people mistook Absol as a bringer of doom.
cobblemon.species.wynaut.name: Wynaut
cobblemon.species.wynaut.desc: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.
cobblemon.species.snorunt.name: Snorunt
cobblemon.species.snorunt.desc: Arrives alongside the first snow. It's thought that homes Snorunt visit will prosper for many generations. By tradition, one might offer a lump of ice made from pure water at one's front door.
cobblemon.species.glalie.name: Glalie
cobblemon.species.glalie.desc: It covers its body with an armor of ice harder than steel. Uses its breath to freeze prey, which it then devours as if they were frozen desserts.
cobblemon.species.spheal.name: Spheal
cobblemon.species.spheal.desc: During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal prefers living on the ice—where fewer predators lurk—rather than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.
cobblemon.species.sealeo.name: Sealeo
cobblemon.species.sealeo.desc: Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure the Spheal is healthy.
cobblemon.species.walrein.name: Walrein
cobblemon.species.walrein.desc: Its thick tusks are strong enough to shatter drift ice. They have been known to break, but they will grow back by the next year. The Hisui region is well known for these broken tusks.
cobblemon.species.clamperl.name: Clamperl
cobblemon.species.clamperl.desc: This Pokémon's beautiful pearl is protected by its rock-solid shell, which shrugs off bites even from predators as ferocious as Sharpedo. Clamperl is usually a filter feeder sustained by marine snow, but a particularly hungry specimen may clamp down onto a passing Drowned, latching on for a hearty, rotting, meal.
cobblemon.species.huntail.name: Huntail
cobblemon.species.huntail.desc: Exposure to a thalassic Pokémon's sharp tooth has caused Clamperl to evolve into this form. Huntail has an incredibly powerful jaw, but is far from a mindless hunter, using its bio-luminescent spots and fish-shaped tail to lure in prey before biting down with steel-crushing pressure. Its mouth can open wide enough to take huge bites out of prey larger than itself, and has even been seen devouring whole schools of smaller fish in a single bite.n.
cobblemon.species.gorebyss.name: Gorebyss
cobblemon.species.gorebyss.desc: Exposure to a thalassic Pokémon's beautiful scale has caused Clamperl to evolve into this form. Gorebyss has elegant, tough scales, but is surprisingly aggressive. It uses its strong fins and sharp beak to forcefully jab through anything that could potentially make for a good meal. Although it rarely comes up to the surface, sailors take great caution in waters inhabited by these Pokémon, as they often mistake boats for large prey and can cause serious damage to the hull.
cobblemon.species.relicanth.name: Relicanth
cobblemon.species.relicanth.desc: Comparisons between old records and living individuals show that this Pokémon has existed unchanged for countless generations. At one point, Relicanth was thought to be extinct, but the recent sighting of a specimen inside a deep ocean trench put an end to that possibility. Its rock-hard scales and unique method of swimming allows it to resist the pressure of this environment, but the purpose of the twin red markings on its body is unknown. Legends suggest that these serve as a map to "long-lost giants," but what that means, if anything at all, is still undiscovered.
cobblemon.species.luvdisc.name: Luvdisc
cobblemon.species.luvdisc.desc: These shallow-swimming Pokémon are known for their strong social bonds, and they become despondent when separated from their companion.
