cobblemon.species.tyrunt.desc: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.
cobblemon.species.tyrantrum.name: Tyrantrum
cobblemon.species.tyrantrum.desc: A single bite of Tyrantrum's massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.
cobblemon.species.amaura.name: Amaura
cobblemon.species.amaura.desc: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.
cobblemon.species.aurorus.name: Aurorus
cobblemon.species.aurorus.desc: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.
cobblemon.species.sylveon.name: Sylveon
cobblemon.species.sylveon.desc: It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to the situation.
cobblemon.species.hawlucha.name: Hawlucha
cobblemon.species.hawlucha.desc: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.
cobblemon.species.dedenne.name: Dedenne
cobblemon.species.dedenne.desc: Since Dedenne can't generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.carbink.name: Carbink
cobblemon.species.carbink.desc: Carbink are found deep underground, where they were born from high temperatures and pressure millenia ago. It tends to be found more frequently near ore deposits in particular, so seeing one is often considered a good omen among mining settlements. However, the jewels comprising its body become brittle if removed, so they are not well-suited for forging tools and armor. Carbink mainly uses these jewels to fire beams of energy that punish would-be attackers.
cobblemon.species.goomy.name: Goomy
cobblemon.species.goomy.desc: Many consider Goomy to be the weakest of all Dragon-type Pokémon, but its slimy body is durable and most attacks simply slide off it. The film that covers its skin dries out in the sun, which is why it prefers dark, damp places. However, it gathers the majority of its nutrients from rainwater, so it will often choose to stay near the surface.
cobblemon.species.goomy-hisui.desc: The few Goomy who live in caves absorb minerals from their surroundings and incorporate them into their own bodies. Because they still need water to live, they prefer caves with natural aquifers, however, food is often scarce in the areas they make their homes. Thankfully, they can go months without eating after a meal of roots or lichen.
cobblemon.species.sliggoo.name: Sliggoo
cobblemon.species.sliggoo.desc: Sliggoo relies primarily on its horns to sense food, and when it does, it uses a strong acid it produces to dissolve and digest anything it comes across. Upon evolution, its organs all shifted into the lump on its back, meaning its eyes have atrophied into weak sensory organs. Because of this, it sometimes accidentally targets its own trainer.
cobblemon.species.sliggoo-hisui.desc: The metal that Sliggoo absorbed has solidified into a protective shell. Its temperament has also changed, and it is now less cheerful and more prone to melancholy. Due to the metal that covers the lower half of its body, this Pokémon has a hard time moving, forcing it to use its small arms to pull itself along the ground.
cobblemon.species.goodra.name: Goodra
cobblemon.species.goodra.desc: Few trainers have the patience to raise Goomy long enough for it to evolve into this Pokémon, but those that do find Goodra to be a Pokémon of formidable strength. The acidic mucus that coats its skin is much less potent than that of Sliggoo, but it makes up for this with its deceptively muscular horns and tail. Despite its strength, it has a meek disposition and prefers to surround itself with friends. If you find yourself being one of these friends, don't get mad when Goodra gives you an extra-slimey hug.
cobblemon.species.goodra-hisui.desc: It has grown stronger with evolution, but the weight of its shell still causes it to tire more easily. However, if threatened, Goodra can retreat into this shell, a nigh impenetrable stronghold made of iron and other strong minerals. Exceedingly anxious, this Pokémon will go on a violent rampage if its trainer leaves its sight, believing it has been abandoned.
cobblemon.species.klefki.name: Klefki
cobblemon.species.klefki.desc: This mysterious Pokémon has a strange fondness for keys, and it is perfectly willing to snatch up any that happen to be left unguarded. This tendency has given it a reputation as a pest in many places, although some entrust it with valuable passkeys as protection from thieves. Klefki is especially fond of rare and unusual keys, and is thus often found within the mazelike tunnels of Trial Chambers.
cobblemon.species.phantump.name: Phantump
cobblemon.species.phantump.desc: With a voice like a human child's, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
cobblemon.species.trevenant.name: Trevenant
cobblemon.species.trevenant.desc: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon's feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.
cobblemon.species.pumpkaboo.name: Pumpkaboo
cobblemon.species.pumpkaboo.desc: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.
cobblemon.species.gourgeist.name: Gourgeist
cobblemon.species.gourgeist.desc: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.
cobblemon.species.bergmite.name: Bergmite
cobblemon.species.bergmite.desc: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.
cobblemon.species.avalugg.name: Avalugg
cobblemon.species.avalugg.desc: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
cobblemon.species.noibat.name: Noibat
cobblemon.species.noibat.desc: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat's ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.noivern.name: Noivern
cobblemon.species.noivern.desc: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
cobblemon.species.xerneas.name: Xerneas
cobblemon.species.xerneas.desc: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
cobblemon.species.yveltal.name: Yveltal
cobblemon.species.yveltal.desc: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
cobblemon.species.zygarde.name: Zygarde
cobblemon.species.zygarde.desc: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
cobblemon.species.diancie.name: Diancie
cobblemon.species.diancie.desc: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
cobblemon.species.hoopa.name: Hoopa
cobblemon.species.hoopa.desc: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
cobblemon.species.volcanion.name: Volcanion
cobblemon.species.volcanion.desc: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
cobblemon.species.rowlet.name: Rowlet
cobblemon.species.rowlet.desc: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.
cobblemon.species.dartrix.name: Dartrix
cobblemon.species.dartrix.desc: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.
cobblemon.species.decidueye.name: Decidueye
cobblemon.species.decidueye.desc: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
cobblemon.species.litten.name: Litten
cobblemon.species.litten.desc: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.
cobblemon.species.torracat.name: Torracat
cobblemon.species.torracat.desc: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat's fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.
cobblemon.species.incineroar.name: Incineroar
cobblemon.species.incineroar.desc: Incineroar's rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.
cobblemon.species.popplio.name: Popplio
cobblemon.species.popplio.desc: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.
cobblemon.species.brionne.name: Brionne
cobblemon.species.brionne.desc: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that's leading them.
cobblemon.species.primarina.name: Primarina
cobblemon.species.primarina.desc: For Primarina, every battle's a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.
cobblemon.species.pikipek.name: Pikipek
cobblemon.species.pikipek.desc: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
cobblemon.species.trumbeak.name: Trumbeak
cobblemon.species.trumbeak.desc: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
cobblemon.species.toucannon.name: Toucannon
cobblemon.species.toucannon.desc: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
cobblemon.species.yungoos.name: Yungoos
cobblemon.species.yungoos.desc: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
cobblemon.species.gumshoos.name: Gumshoos
cobblemon.species.gumshoos.desc: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!
cobblemon.species.grubbin.name: Grubbin
cobblemon.species.grubbin.desc: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.
cobblemon.species.charjabug.name: Charjabug
cobblemon.species.charjabug.desc: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.
cobblemon.species.vikavolt.name: Vikavolt
cobblemon.species.vikavolt.desc: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.
cobblemon.species.crabrawler.name: Crabrawler
cobblemon.species.crabrawler.desc: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.
cobblemon.species.crabominable.name: Crabominable
cobblemon.species.crabominable.desc: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.
cobblemon.species.oricorio.name: Oricorio
cobblemon.species.oricorio.desc: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
cobblemon.species.cutiefly.name: Cutiefly
cobblemon.species.cutiefly.desc: An opponent's aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent's next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.
cobblemon.species.ribombee.name: Ribombee
cobblemon.species.ribombee.desc: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.
cobblemon.species.rockruff.name: Rockruff
cobblemon.species.rockruff.desc: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
cobblemon.species.lycanroc.name: Lycanroc
cobblemon.species.lycanroc.desc: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc's fangs are always aimed toward opponents' weak spots.
cobblemon.species.wishiwashi.name: Wishiwashi
cobblemon.species.wishiwashi.desc: Wishiwashi shine their eyes to signal danger as well as communicate, allowing them to call for others of their kind to form a powerful, coordinated school. However, Wishiwashi that are injured have trouble shining their eyes, and cannot form these schools. This leaves them pitifully weak as a result.
cobblemon.species.wishiwashi-school.desc: When huge swaths of otherwise weak Wishiwashi come together, they form a gigantic school often referred to as the "demon of the sea" by those who live on the coast. These Pokémon work in terrifying unison to bring down even the toughest foes, with the power of every individual Wishiwashi combined being enough to make even Gyarados flee. This fearsome strength has caused the Pokémon to be mistaken for a legendary beast on multiple occasions.
cobblemon.species.mareanie.name: Mareanie
cobblemon.species.mareanie.desc: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.
cobblemon.species.toxapex.name: Toxapex
cobblemon.species.toxapex.desc: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.
cobblemon.species.mudbray.name: Mudbray
cobblemon.species.mudbray.desc: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.
cobblemon.species.mudsdale.name: Mudsdale
cobblemon.species.mudsdale.desc: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.
cobblemon.species.dewpider.name: Dewpider
cobblemon.species.dewpider.desc: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.
cobblemon.species.araquanid.name: Araquanid
cobblemon.species.araquanid.desc: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.
cobblemon.species.fomantis.name: Fomantis
cobblemon.species.fomantis.desc: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.
cobblemon.species.lurantis.name: Lurantis
cobblemon.species.lurantis.desc: The petals on this Pokémon's arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.
cobblemon.species.morelull.name: Morelull
cobblemon.species.morelull.desc: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.
cobblemon.species.shiinotic.name: Shiinotic
cobblemon.species.shiinotic.desc: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don't go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.
cobblemon.species.salandit.name: Salandit
cobblemon.species.salandit.desc: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.
cobblemon.species.salazzle.name: Salazzle
cobblemon.species.salazzle.desc: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.
cobblemon.species.stufful.name: Stufful
cobblemon.species.stufful.desc: Many people love this Pokémon due to its adorable appearance, and it is especially popular with children. Unfortunately, Stufful hates being touched by anyone except its friends, causing it to lash out violently with enough force to pulverize stone. Despite its strength, it feeds primarily on berries and spends most of its time sleeping.
cobblemon.species.bewear.name: Bewear
cobblemon.species.bewear.desc: You can tell you are in a Bewear’s territory by the toppled trees and pulverized rocks that litter the area. Travelers are advised to avoid regions in which it dwells at all cost, as a single swipe from its powerful arms can send a full-grown Steelix flying. Even when this terrifying Pokémon is tame and friendly, its well-meaning hugs can lead to the serious injury of its trainer.
cobblemon.species.bounsweet.name: Bounsweet
cobblemon.species.bounsweet.desc: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.
cobblemon.species.steenee.name: Steenee
cobblemon.species.steenee.desc: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.
cobblemon.species.tsareena.name: Tsareena
cobblemon.species.tsareena.desc: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon's legs leaves a wound in the opponent's body and soul that will never heal.
cobblemon.species.comfey.name: Comfey
cobblemon.species.comfey.desc: These Pokémon smell very nice. All Comfey wear different flowers, so each of these Pokémon has its own individual scent.
cobblemon.species.oranguru.name: Oranguru
cobblemon.species.oranguru.desc: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.
cobblemon.species.passimian.name: Passimian
cobblemon.species.passimian.desc: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.
cobblemon.species.wimpod.name: Wimpod
cobblemon.species.wimpod.desc: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy's presence.
cobblemon.species.golisopod.name: Golisopod
cobblemon.species.golisopod.desc: They live in sunken ships or in holes in the seabed. When Golisopod and Grapploct battle, the loser becomes the winner's meal.
cobblemon.species.sandygast.name: Sandygast
cobblemon.species.sandygast.desc: Sandygast are very protective of the shovels embedded in their heads. However, it doesn't seem to be made of any known material.
cobblemon.species.palossand.name: Palossand
cobblemon.species.palossand.desc: It is said that when a Drowned is reanimated, its departed soul joins a colony of others to create a Palossand.
cobblemon.species.pyukumuku.name: Pyukumuku
cobblemon.species.pyukumuku.desc: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
cobblemon.species.typenull.name: Type: Null
cobblemon.species.typenull.desc: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.
cobblemon.species.silvally.name: Silvally
cobblemon.species.silvally.desc: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon's true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
cobblemon.species.minior.name: Minior
cobblemon.species.minior.desc: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.
cobblemon.species.komala.name: Komala
cobblemon.species.komala.desc: This Pokémon spends its entire life in a comatose state due to toxins in the leaves comprising its diet; even newly-hatched Komala are born asleep. Every movement it makes is just it tossing and turning in its dreams, which so conveniently happen to coincide with events in the waking world, such as battles. Researchers have attempted to study these dreams to find out how this is, but Komala seems to have an awareness of when it is being studied, and it lashes out violently.
cobblemon.species.turtonator.name: Turtonator
cobblemon.species.turtonator.desc: Turtonator commonly buries itself in basalt deltas, waiting for its prey to wander too close. If stepped on, it will detonate the explosive fluid in its shell by striking it with its tail. The resulting explosion is enough to easily take down anything that steps too close. In order to replenish this compound after use, Turtonator seems to hunt and consume Magma Cubes, turning their precious magma cream into fuel for its explosions.
cobblemon.species.togedemaru.name: Togedemaru
cobblemon.species.togedemaru.desc: When it's in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.
cobblemon.species.mimikyu.name: Mimikyu
cobblemon.species.mimikyu.desc: This Pokémon tends to reside in dry, dark places, where no moisture can damage the rags it cloaks itself in. Perhaps in an effort to appear less frightful and more loveable, Mimikyu fashions its rags into a Pikachu-like disguise. However, the result comes out to be... rather creepy. Despite this, it would seem that this Pokémon has developed a small number of fans who find its patchwork disguise and attention-seeking nature endearing.
cobblemon.species.mimikyu-busted.desc: The force of a blow from battle causes the neck of Mimikyu's disguise to snap. In some unfortunate scenarios, this can also cause the cloth to rip, giving anyone in the area a glimpse at the unknowable mass of shadow underneath. This Pokémon's true form is still unknown, as every scholar who has ventured to research it has either died directly by Mimikyu's hand or lived in mental anguish until their premature demise.
cobblemon.species.bruxish.name: Bruxish
cobblemon.species.bruxish.desc: Its skin is thick enough to fend off Mareanie's spikes. With its robust teeth, Bruxish crunches up the spikes and eats them.
cobblemon.species.drampa.name: Drampa
cobblemon.species.drampa.desc: Drampa is a kind and friendly Pokémon—up until it's angered. When that happens, it stirs up a gale and flattens everything around.
cobblemon.species.dhelmise.name: Dhelmise
cobblemon.species.dhelmise.desc: This clump of restless green seaweed has found and fused to the anchor of a sunken ship. Dhelmise uses this heavy hunk of steel not only as a body, but as a weapon as well. This oversized bludgeon is employed to target larger prey, like the otherwise unthreatened Wailord. If one strays too close to Dhelmise's shipwreck home, it will tangle and drag it down to the seafloor with its chain-like seaweed before using its anchor to deal the final blow.
cobblemon.species.jangmoo.name: Jangmo-o
cobblemon.species.jangmoo.desc: Jangmo-o strikes its scales to communicate with others of its kind. Its scales are actually fur that's become as hard as metal.
cobblemon.species.hakamoo.name: Hakamo-o
cobblemon.species.hakamoo.desc: Before attacking its enemies, it clashes its scales together and roars. Its sharp claws shred the opposition.
cobblemon.species.kommoo.name: Kommo-o
cobblemon.species.kommoo.desc: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.
cobblemon.species.tapukoko.name: Tapu Koko
cobblemon.species.tapukoko.desc: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.
cobblemon.species.tapulele.name: Tapu Lele
cobblemon.species.tapulele.desc: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.
cobblemon.species.tapubulu.name: Tapu Bulu
cobblemon.species.tapubulu.desc: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula'ula controls plants.
cobblemon.species.tapufini.name: Tapu Fini
cobblemon.species.tapufini.desc: Although it's called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.
cobblemon.species.cosmog.name: Cosmog
cobblemon.species.cosmog.desc: Cosmog is very curious but not very cautious, often placing itself in danger. If things start to look dicey, it teleports away.
cobblemon.species.cosmoem.name: Cosmoem
cobblemon.species.cosmoem.desc: It sucks in dust from the air at an astounding rate, frantically building up energy within its core as preparation for evolution.
cobblemon.species.solgaleo.name: Solgaleo
cobblemon.species.solgaleo.desc: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.
cobblemon.species.lunala.name: Lunala
cobblemon.species.lunala.desc: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.
cobblemon.species.nihilego.name: Nihilego
cobblemon.species.nihilego.desc: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.buzzwole.name: Buzzwole
cobblemon.species.buzzwole.desc: Buzzwole goes around showing off its abnormally swollen muscles. It is one kind of Ultra Beast.
cobblemon.species.pheromosa.name: Pheromosa
cobblemon.species.pheromosa.desc: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.xurkitree.name: Xurkitree
cobblemon.species.xurkitree.desc: They've been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
cobblemon.species.celesteela.name: Celesteela
cobblemon.species.celesteela.desc: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.kartana.name: Kartana
cobblemon.species.kartana.desc: Although it's alien to this world and a danger here, it's apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
cobblemon.species.guzzlord.name: Guzzlord
cobblemon.species.guzzlord.desc: An unknown life-form called a UB. It may be constantly hungry—it is certainly always devouring something.
cobblemon.species.necrozma.name: Necrozma
cobblemon.species.necrozma.desc: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.
cobblemon.species.magearna.name: Magearna
cobblemon.species.magearna.desc: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.
cobblemon.species.marshadow.name: Marshadow
cobblemon.species.marshadow.desc: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.
cobblemon.species.poipole.name: Poipole
cobblemon.species.poipole.desc: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
cobblemon.species.naganadel.name: Naganadel
cobblemon.species.naganadel.desc: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
cobblemon.species.stakataka.name: Stakataka
cobblemon.species.stakataka.desc: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute's true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
cobblemon.species.blacephalon.name: Blacephalon
cobblemon.species.blacephalon.desc: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it causes explosions, then takes advantage of opponents' surprise to rob them of their vitality.
cobblemon.species.zeraora.name: Zeraora
cobblemon.species.zeraora.desc: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.
cobblemon.species.meltan.name: Meltan
cobblemon.species.meltan.desc: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.
cobblemon.species.melmetal.name: Melmetal
cobblemon.species.melmetal.desc: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal's heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.grookey.name: Grookey
cobblemon.species.grookey.desc: It attacks with rapid beats of its stick. As it strikes with amazing speed, it gets more and more pumped.
cobblemon.species.thwackey.name: Thwackey
cobblemon.species.thwackey.desc: When it's drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won't even notice that it's already knocked out its opponent.
cobblemon.species.rillaboom.name: Rillaboom
cobblemon.species.rillaboom.desc: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.
cobblemon.species.scorbunny.name: Scorbunny
cobblemon.species.scorbunny.desc: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it's raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.
cobblemon.species.raboot.name: Raboot
cobblemon.species.raboot.desc: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.
cobblemon.species.cinderace.name: Cinderace
cobblemon.species.cinderace.desc: It's skilled at both offense and defense, and it gets pumped up when cheered on. But if it starts showboating, it could put itself in a tough spot.
cobblemon.species.sobble.name: Sobble
cobblemon.species.sobble.desc: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
cobblemon.species.drizzile.name: Drizzile
cobblemon.species.drizzile.desc: Highly intelligent but also very lazy, it keeps enemies out of its territory by laying traps everywhere.
cobblemon.species.inteleon.name: Inteleon
cobblemon.species.inteleon.desc: Its nictitating membranes let it pick out foes' weak points so it can precisely blast them with water that shoots from its fingertips at Mach 3.
cobblemon.species.skwovet.name: Skwovet
cobblemon.species.skwovet.desc: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It'll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.
cobblemon.species.greedent.name: Greedent
cobblemon.species.greedent.desc: Common throughout the Galar region, this Pokémon has strong teeth and can chew through the toughest of berry shells.
cobblemon.species.rookidee.name: Rookidee
cobblemon.species.rookidee.desc: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.
cobblemon.species.corvisquire.name: Corvisquire
cobblemon.species.corvisquire.desc: The lessons of many harsh battles have taught it how to accurately judge an opponent's strength.
cobblemon.species.corviknight.name: Corviknight
cobblemon.species.corviknight.desc: With their great intellect and flying skills, these Pokémon very successfully act as the Galar region's airborne taxi service.
cobblemon.species.blipbug.name: Blipbug
cobblemon.species.blipbug.desc: Often found in gardens, this Pokémon has hairs on its body that it uses to assess its surroundings.
cobblemon.species.dottler.name: Dottler
cobblemon.species.dottler.desc: As it grows inside its shell, it uses its psychic abilities to monitor the outside world and prepare for evolution.
cobblemon.species.orbeetle.name: Orbeetle
cobblemon.species.orbeetle.desc: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what's around it—and what's around it can include things over six miles away.
cobblemon.species.nickit.name: Nickit
cobblemon.species.nickit.desc: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
cobblemon.species.thievul.name: Thievul
cobblemon.species.thievul.desc: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.
cobblemon.species.gossifleur.name: Gossifleur
cobblemon.species.gossifleur.desc: It whirls around in the wind while singing a joyous song. This delightful display has charmed many into raising this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.eldegoss.name: Eldegoss
cobblemon.species.eldegoss.desc: The cotton on the head of this Pokémon can be spun into a glossy, gorgeous yarn—a Galar regional specialty.
cobblemon.species.wooloo.name: Wooloo
cobblemon.species.wooloo.desc: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won't be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.
cobblemon.species.dubwool.name: Dubwool
cobblemon.species.dubwool.desc: Its majestic horns are meant only to impress the opposite gender. They never see use in battle.
cobblemon.species.chewtle.name: Chewtle
cobblemon.species.chewtle.desc: It starts off battles by attacking with its rock-hard horn, but as soon as the opponent flinches, this Pokémon bites down and never lets go.
cobblemon.species.drednaw.name: Drednaw
cobblemon.species.drednaw.desc: This Pokémon rapidly extends its retractable neck to sink its sharp fangs into distant enemies and take them down.
cobblemon.species.yamper.name: Yamper
cobblemon.species.yamper.desc: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
cobblemon.species.boltund.name: Boltund
cobblemon.species.boltund.desc: It sends electricity through its legs to boost their strength. Running at top speed, it easily breaks 50 mph.
cobblemon.species.rolycoly.name: Rolycoly
cobblemon.species.rolycoly.desc: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
cobblemon.species.carkol.name: Carkol
cobblemon.species.carkol.desc: By rapidly rolling its legs, it can travel at over 18 mph. The temperature of the flames it breathes exceeds 1,800 degrees Fahrenheit.
cobblemon.species.coalossal.name: Coalossal
cobblemon.species.coalossal.desc: While it's engaged in battle, its mountain of coal will burn bright red, sending off sparks that scorch the surrounding area.
cobblemon.species.applin.name: Applin
cobblemon.species.applin.desc: As soon as it's born, it burrows into an apple. Not only does the apple serve as its food source, but the flavor of the fruit determines its evolution.
cobblemon.species.flapple.name: Flapple
cobblemon.species.flapple.desc: It flies on wings of apple skin and spits a powerful acid. It can also change its shape into that of an apple.
cobblemon.species.appletun.name: Appletun
cobblemon.species.appletun.desc: Its body is covered in sweet nectar, and the skin on its back is especially yummy. Children used to have it as a snack.
cobblemon.species.silicobra.name: Silicobra
cobblemon.species.silicobra.desc: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
cobblemon.species.sandaconda.name: Sandaconda
cobblemon.species.sandaconda.desc: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.
cobblemon.species.cramorant.name: Cramorant
cobblemon.species.cramorant.desc: This hungry Pokémon swallows Arrokuda whole. Occasionally, it makes a mistake and tries to swallow a Pokémon other than its preferred prey.
cobblemon.species.arrokuda.name: Arrokuda
cobblemon.species.arrokuda.desc: After it's eaten its fill, its movements become extremely sluggish. That's when Cramorant swallows it up.
cobblemon.species.barraskewda.name: Barraskewda
cobblemon.species.barraskewda.desc: It spins its tail fins to propel itself, surging forward at speeds of over 100 knots before ramming prey and spearing into them.
cobblemon.species.toxel.name: Toxel
cobblemon.species.toxel.desc: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.
cobblemon.species.toxtricity.name: Toxtricity
cobblemon.species.toxtricity.desc: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.
cobblemon.species.sizzlipede.name: Sizzlipede
cobblemon.species.sizzlipede.desc: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they're well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
cobblemon.species.centiskorch.name: Centiskorch
cobblemon.species.centiskorch.desc: While its burning body is already dangerous on its own, this excessively hostile Pokémon also has large and very sharp fangs.
cobblemon.species.clobbopus.name: Clobbopus
cobblemon.species.clobbopus.desc: Its tentacles tear off easily, but it isn't alarmed when that happens—it knows they'll grow back. It's about as smart as a three-year-old.
cobblemon.species.grapploct.name: Grapploct
cobblemon.species.grapploct.desc: Searching for an opponent to test its skills against, it emerges onto land. Once the battle is over, it returns to the sea.
cobblemon.species.sinistea.name: Sinistea
cobblemon.species.sinistea.desc: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.
cobblemon.species.polteageist.name: Polteageist
cobblemon.species.polteageist.desc: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.
cobblemon.species.hatenna.name: Hatenna
cobblemon.species.hatenna.desc: If this Pokémon senses a strong emotion, it will run away as fast as it can. It prefers areas without people.
cobblemon.species.hattrem.name: Hattrem
cobblemon.species.hattrem.desc: Using the braids on its head, it pummels foes to get them to quiet down. One blow from those braids would knock out a professional boxer.
cobblemon.species.hatterene.name: Hatterene
cobblemon.species.hatterene.desc: If you're too loud around it, you risk being torn apart by the claws on its tentacle. This Pokémon is also known as the Forest Witch.
cobblemon.species.impidimp.name: Impidimp
cobblemon.species.impidimp.desc: These mischevious Pokémon live in groups deep inside dark, roofed forests that the undead call home. Impdimp will often follow explorers passing through their forest home, watching and giggling as they're swarmed by monsters from all angles - this is because Impidimp feeds off of negative emotion, so a traveler confounded by zombies, skeletons, and spiders alike is a feast for these diminuitive rascals.
cobblemon.species.morgrem.name: Morgrem
cobblemon.species.morgrem.desc: What Morgrem lacks in physical strength, it makes up for with cunning and dirty tactics. This Pokémon never fights fairly, and it prefers to feign surrender in order to stab those who corner it with its long, sharp hair. Despite taking great pride in using intelligence over brute force, Morgrem seems to envy physically strong Pokémon such as Machamp.
cobblemon.species.grimmsnarl.name: Grimmsnarl
cobblemon.species.grimmsnarl.desc: Even though it appears to have gained great muscle strength, this is yet another sneaky deception by Grimmsnarl - these "muscles" are actually part of its hair, which it can unfurl at will to wrap around its opponents like tentacles. It seems to have great confidence in this masquerade, but it gets very angry if anyone happens to sneak a glance at the meek, true body underneath its mane.
cobblemon.species.obstagoon.name: Obstagoon
cobblemon.species.obstagoon.desc: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
cobblemon.species.perrserker.name: Perrserker
cobblemon.species.perrserker.desc: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.
cobblemon.species.cursola.name: Cursola
cobblemon.species.cursola.desc: Be cautious of the ectoplasmic body surrounding its soul. You'll become stiff as stone if you touch it.
cobblemon.species.sirfetchd.name: Sirfetch'd
cobblemon.species.sirfetchd.desc: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.
cobblemon.species.mrrime.name: Mr. Rime
cobblemon.species.mrrime.desc: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
cobblemon.species.runerigus.name: Runerigus
cobblemon.species.runerigus.desc: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you'll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
cobblemon.species.milcery.name: Milcery
cobblemon.species.milcery.desc: Exceedingly elusive and shy by nature, Milcery are rarely seen in the wild. They possess a strange affinity for confectioneries, however, and are sometimes drawn to human settlements by the scent of a freshly baked cake. Popular belief states that these cream-bodied Pokémon bring a delicious flavour to any baked good they visit, so Milcery are a welcome sight in most places.
cobblemon.species.alcremie.name: Alcremie
cobblemon.species.alcremie.desc: Depending on the conditions in which it evolved, Alcremie can take on a myriad of different forms, each capable of producing a differently flavoured cream. This form's cream is mild in flavor, which it uses to lend a hand in the production of delicious pastries. Alcremie also uses this cream as a defense mechanism, hurling it at foes to confuse and slow them.
cobblemon.species.falinks.name: Falinks
cobblemon.species.falinks.desc: The six of them work together as one Pokémon. Teamwork is also their battle strategy, and they constantly change their formation as they fight.
cobblemon.species.pincurchin.name: Pincurchin
cobblemon.species.pincurchin.desc: Pincurchin is a dweller of the ocean floor, slowly moving along in search of seagrass to eat. It is very timid in nature, and even a passing current can startle it, causing it to discharge powerful jolts of electricity from its spines. This defense mechanism is effective against most predators in its aquatic environment, but it leaves Pincurchin vulnerable to those with an immunity to electricity.
cobblemon.species.snom.name: Snom
cobblemon.species.snom.desc: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.
cobblemon.species.frosmoth.name: Frosmoth
cobblemon.species.frosmoth.desc: It shows no mercy to any who desecrate fields and mountains. It will fly around on its icy wings, causing a blizzard to chase offenders away.
cobblemon.species.stonjourner.name: Stonjourner
cobblemon.species.stonjourner.desc: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
cobblemon.species.eiscue.name: Eiscue
cobblemon.species.eiscue.desc: Eiscue live in coastal, frozen seas, making their nests on glaciers and sliding playfully along the ice. The single hair on their heads radiate an intense cold, freezing the seawater around them into a protective block of ice. Although this helmet is heavy, it is very buoyant, allowing Eiscue to travel long distances by simply floating on the current.
cobblemon.species.eiscue-noice.desc: When subject to a particularly forceful blow, the ice blocks that cover an Eiscue's head shatters completely, leaving their small heads exposed. Although they usually tend to avoid this shattering, there are cases where they are seen causing it intentionally. Because they are much quicker without their block, they oftentimes shatter it before diving for their prey.
cobblemon.species.indeedee.name: Indeedee
cobblemon.species.indeedee.desc: Through its horns, it can pick up on the emotions of creatures around it. Positive emotions are the source of its strength.
cobblemon.species.morpeko.name: Morpeko
cobblemon.species.morpeko.desc: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they're precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
cobblemon.species.cufant.name: Cufant
cobblemon.species.cufant.desc: If a job requires serious strength, this Pokémon will excel at it. Its copper body tarnishes in the rain, turning a vibrant green color.
cobblemon.species.copperajah.name: Copperajah
cobblemon.species.copperajah.desc: These Pokémon live in herds. Their trunks have incredible grip strength, strong enough to crush giant rocks into powder.
cobblemon.species.dracozolt.name: Dracozolt
cobblemon.species.dracozolt.desc: The result of jamming two mismatched fossils into a Resurrection Machine. This unfortunate mistake is a combination of a small, nimble raptor and a large, strong-legged prehistoric creature. While this combination allows for it to ram foes at high speeds, its large legs require much more food than its small mouth and stomach can handle. As a result of this, it spends 90% of its life just eating.
cobblemon.species.arctozolt.name: Arctozolt
cobblemon.species.arctozolt.desc: The result of jamming two mismatched fossils into a Resurrection Machine. This woeful mistake is a combination of a small, nimble raptor and a frozen, semi-aquatic creature. It only has flippers for legs, but because it cannot breathe underwater, it's forced to awkwardly waddle alongside frozen seas, just waiting for food to wash ashore.
cobblemon.species.dracovish.name: Dracovish
cobblemon.species.dracovish.desc: The result of jamming two mismatched fossils into a Resurrection Machine. This unfortunate blunder is a combination of a plate-jawed fish and a large, strong-legged creature. While its powerful legs allow it to run extremely well, it cannot breathe outside of the water. Because of this, it tends to just get out its energy by running along the seafloor.
cobblemon.species.arctovish.name: Arctovish
cobblemon.species.arctovish.desc: The result of jamming two mismatched fossils into a Resurrection Machine. This woeful blunder is a combination of a plate-jawed fish and a frozen, semi-aquatic creature. While this combination of two at least partially aquatic creatures should theoretically work, its head was somehow inverted in the revival process, making it nearly impossible for it to eat and uncomfortable for it to breathe.
cobblemon.species.duraludon.name: Duraludon
cobblemon.species.duraludon.desc: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.
cobblemon.species.dreepy.name: Dreepy
cobblemon.species.dreepy.desc: If this weak Pokémon is by itself, a mere child could defeat it. But if Dreepy has friends to help it train, it can evolve and become much stronger.
cobblemon.species.drakloak.name: Drakloak
cobblemon.species.drakloak.desc: Without a Dreepy to place on its head and care for, it gets so uneasy it'll try to substitute any Pokémon it finds for the missing Dreepy.
cobblemon.species.dragapult.name: Dragapult
cobblemon.species.dragapult.desc: Apparently the Dreepy inside Dragapult's horns eagerly look forward to being launched out at Mach speeds.
cobblemon.species.zacian.name: Zacian
cobblemon.species.zacian.desc: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it's Zamazenta's elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.
cobblemon.species.zamazenta.name: Zamazenta
cobblemon.species.zamazenta.desc: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
cobblemon.species.eternatus.name: Eternatus
cobblemon.species.eternatus.desc: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
cobblemon.species.kubfu.name: Kubfu
cobblemon.species.kubfu.desc: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
cobblemon.species.urshifu.name: Urshifu
cobblemon.species.urshifu.desc: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.
cobblemon.species.zarude.name: Zarude
cobblemon.species.zarude.desc: Once the vines on Zarude's body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.
cobblemon.species.regieleki.name: Regieleki
cobblemon.species.regieleki.desc: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar's electricity.
cobblemon.species.regidrago.name: Regidrago
cobblemon.species.regidrago.desc: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.glastrier.name: Glastrier
cobblemon.species.glastrier.desc: Glastrier has tremendous physical strength, and the mask of ice covering its face is 100 times harder than diamond.
cobblemon.species.spectrier.name: Spectrier
cobblemon.species.spectrier.desc: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.
cobblemon.species.calyrex.name: Calyrex
cobblemon.species.calyrex.desc: Calyrex is known in legend as a king that ruled over Galar in ancient times. It has the power to cause hearts to mend and plants to spring forth.
cobblemon.species.wyrdeer.name: Wyrdeer
cobblemon.species.wyrdeer.desc: Stantler that embrace a more strenuous lifestyle and seek self-improvement are able to evolve into Wyrdeer. This evolution is marked by its distinctive beard, which not only serves as an effective means of retaining heat but also symbolizes the wisdom gained from past battles. Additionally, Wyrdeer’s powerful horns shed and regrow each year to ensure that its psychic forces remain strong. Together, these features have enabled the species to thrive in the coldest reaches of the world.
cobblemon.species.kleavor.name: Kleavor
cobblemon.species.kleavor.desc: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.
cobblemon.species.ursaluna.name: Ursaluna
cobblemon.species.ursaluna.desc: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
cobblemon.species.basculegion.name: Basculegion
cobblemon.species.basculegion.desc: Clads itself in the souls of comrades that perished before fulfilling their goals of journeying upstream. No other species throughout all Hisui's rivers is Basculegion's equal.
cobblemon.species.sneasler.name: Sneasler
cobblemon.species.sneasler.desc: This Pokémon reigns supreme at the tops of frozen peaks, using its lanky limbs to traverse harsh cliffs with remarkable ease. The venom dripping from Sneasler's large claws is potent enough to shut down its prey's nervous system, making it a fearsome foe. Sneasler has developed a solitary disposition, preferring to survive alone rather than in a group. Upon evolution, it bids farewell to its former pack and sets out in search of a territory to call its own.
cobblemon.species.overqwil.name: Overqwil
cobblemon.species.overqwil.desc: Huge schools of Overqwil float in the open ocean, slowly drifting along the current. Sailors have dubbed these Pokémon as "Sea Fiends," because of the many shipwrecks they're responsible for. Those who attempt to flee from the wreckage are targeted with the virulent poison they spew from their spikes.
cobblemon.species.enamorus.name: Enamorus
cobblemon.species.enamorus.desc: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.
cobblemon.species.sprigatito.name: Sprigatito
cobblemon.species.sprigatito.desc: Its fluffy fur is similar in composition to plants. This Pokémon frequently washes its face to keep it from drying out.
cobblemon.species.floragato.name: Floragato
cobblemon.species.floragato.desc: Floragato deftly wields the vine hidden beneath its long fur, slamming the hard flower bud against its opponents.
cobblemon.species.meowscarada.name: Meowscarada
cobblemon.species.meowscarada.desc: This Pokémon uses the reflective fur lining in its cape to camouflage the stem of its flower, creating the illusion that the flower is floating.
cobblemon.species.fuecoco.name: Fuecoco
cobblemon.species.fuecoco.desc: It lies on warm rocks and uses the heat absorbed by its square-shaped scales to create fire energy.
cobblemon.species.crocalor.name: Crocalor
cobblemon.species.crocalor.desc: The combination of Crocalor's fire energy and overflowing vitality has caused an egg-shaped fireball to appear on the Pokémon's head.
cobblemon.species.skeledirge.name: Skeledirge
cobblemon.species.skeledirge.desc: The fiery bird changes shape when Skeledirge sings. Rumor has it that the bird was born when the fireball on Skeledirge's head gained a soul.
cobblemon.species.quaxly.name: Quaxly
cobblemon.species.quaxly.desc: This Pokémon migrated to Paldea from distant lands long ago. The gel secreted by its feathers repels water and grime.
cobblemon.species.quaxwell.name: Quaxwell
cobblemon.species.quaxwell.desc: These Pokémon constantly run through shallow waters to train their legs, then compete with each other to see which of them kicks most gracefully.
cobblemon.species.quaquaval.name: Quaquaval
cobblemon.species.quaquaval.desc: A single kick from a Quaquaval can send a truck rolling. This Pokémon uses its powerful legs to perform striking dances from far-off lands.
cobblemon.species.lechonk.name: Lechonk
cobblemon.species.lechonk.desc: It searches for food all day. It possesses a keen sense of smell but doesn't use it for anything other than foraging.
cobblemon.species.oinkologne.name: Oinkologne
cobblemon.species.oinkologne.desc: This is a meticulous Pokémon that likes to keep things tidy. It shrouds itself in a floral aroma that soothes the Pokémon around it.
cobblemon.species.tarountula.name: Tarountula
cobblemon.species.tarountula.desc: The ball of threads wrapped around its body is elastic enough to deflect the scythes of Scyther, this Pokémon's natural enemy.
cobblemon.species.spidops.name: Spidops
cobblemon.species.spidops.desc: It clings to branches and ceilings using its threads and moves without a sound. It takes out its prey before the prey even notices it.
cobblemon.species.nymble.name: Nymble
cobblemon.species.nymble.desc: It has its third set of legs folded up. When it's in a tough spot, this Pokémon jumps over 30 feet using the strength of its legs.
cobblemon.species.lokix.name: Lokix
cobblemon.species.lokix.desc: When it decides to fight all out, it stands on its previously folded legs to enter Showdown Mode. It neutralizes its enemies in short order.
cobblemon.species.pawmi.name: Pawmi
cobblemon.species.pawmi.desc: It has underdeveloped electric sacs on its cheeks. These sacs can produce electricity only if Pawmi rubs them furiously with the pads on its forepaws.
cobblemon.species.pawmo.name: Pawmo
cobblemon.species.pawmo.desc: When its group is attacked, Pawmo is the first to leap into battle, defeating enemies with a fighting technique that utilizes electric shocks.
cobblemon.species.pawmot.name: Pawmot
cobblemon.species.pawmot.desc: This Pokémon normally is slow to react, but once it enters battle, it will strike down its enemies with lightning-fast movements.
cobblemon.species.tandemaus.name: Tandemaus
cobblemon.species.tandemaus.desc: These two exhibit unrivaled teamwork and cooperation, sharing their food evenly and coordinating in perfect sync when in battle. Even when searching for materials to make a nest with, Tandemaus never stray away from each other. They're often considered pests by townsfolk, as they'll chew bits of fabric for their nests off of anything they find.
cobblemon.species.maushold.name: Maushold
cobblemon.species.maushold.desc: Most Maushold consist of a larger pair and a smaller pair, but in rare circumstances there will only be one little one. The scarcity of these Maushold has made them difficult to study, and with no information as to the origins of the little ones, it is also unknown why some Maushold only contain a single one.
cobblemon.species.maushold-four.desc: The larger pair fiercely defend the smaller pair, biting anything that threatens them with sharp incisors. If that doesn't stop their opponent, the smaller pair will join the fight. However, Maushold prefer living peacefully in their huge nests, which are separated into several rooms that serve different purposes. This curious behavior has led many to theorize that the group is a family, but studies into this behavior have been inconclusive due to the larger pair attacking researchers that get too close to the smaller pair.
cobblemon.species.fidough.name: Fidough
cobblemon.species.fidough.desc: This Pokémon is smooth and moist to the touch. Yeast in Fidough's breath induces fermentation in the Pokémon's vicinity.
cobblemon.species.dachsbun.name: Dachsbun
cobblemon.species.dachsbun.desc: The pleasant aroma that emanates from this Pokémon's body helps wheat grow, so Dachsbun has been treasured by farming villages.
cobblemon.species.smoliv.name: Smoliv
cobblemon.species.smoliv.desc: It protects itself from enemies by emitting oil from the fruit on its head. This oil is bitter and astringent enough to make someone flinch.
cobblemon.species.dolliv.name: Dolliv
cobblemon.species.dolliv.desc: Dolliv shares its tasty, fresh-scented oil with others. This species has coexisted with humans since times long gone.
cobblemon.species.arboliva.name: Arboliva
cobblemon.species.arboliva.desc: This calm Pokémon is very compassionate. It will share its delicious, nutrient-rich oil with weakened Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.squawkabilly.name: Squawkabilly
cobblemon.species.squawkabilly.desc: These Pokémon prefer to live in cities. They form flocks based on the color of their feathers, and they fight over territory.
cobblemon.species.nacli.name: Nacli
cobblemon.species.nacli.desc: It was born in a layer of rock salt deep under the earth. This species was particularly treasured in the old days, as they would share precious salt.
cobblemon.species.naclstack.name: Naclstack
cobblemon.species.naclstack.desc: This Pokémon dry cures its prey by spraying salt over them. The curing process steals away the water in the prey's body.
cobblemon.species.garganacl.name: Garganacl
cobblemon.species.garganacl.desc: Garganacl will rub its fingertips together and sprinkle injured Pokémon with salt. Even severe wounds will promptly heal afterward.
cobblemon.species.charcadet.name: Charcadet
cobblemon.species.charcadet.desc: Burnt charcoal came to life and became a Pokémon. Possessing a fiery fighting spirit, Charcadet will battle even tough opponents.
cobblemon.species.armarouge.name: Armarouge
cobblemon.species.armarouge.desc: Armarouge evolved through the use of a set of armor that belonged to a distinguished warrior. This Pokémon is incredibly loyal.
cobblemon.species.ceruledge.name: Ceruledge
cobblemon.species.ceruledge.desc: The fiery blades on its arms burn fiercely with the lingering resentment of a sword wielder who fell before accomplishing their goal.
cobblemon.species.tadbulb.name: Tadbulb
cobblemon.species.tadbulb.desc: Tadbulb shakes its tail to generate electricity. If it senses danger, it will make its head blink on and off to alert its allies.
cobblemon.species.bellibolt.name: Bellibolt
cobblemon.species.bellibolt.desc: When this Pokémon expands and contracts its wobbly body, the belly-button dynamo in its stomach produces a huge amount of electricity.
cobblemon.species.wattrel.name: Wattrel
cobblemon.species.wattrel.desc: When its wings catch the wind, the bones within produce electricity. This Pokémon dives into the ocean, catching prey by electrocuting them.
cobblemon.species.kilowattrel.name: Kilowattrel
cobblemon.species.kilowattrel.desc: Kilowattrel inflates its throat sac to amplify its electricity. By riding the wind, this Pokémon can fly over 430 miles in a day.
cobblemon.species.maschiff.name: Maschiff
cobblemon.species.maschiff.desc: It always scowls in an attempt to make opponents take it seriously, but even crying children will burst into laughter when they see Maschiff's face.
cobblemon.species.mabosstiff.name: Mabosstiff
cobblemon.species.mabosstiff.desc: This Pokémon can store energy in its large dewlap. Mabosstiff unleashes this energy all at once to blow away enemies.
cobblemon.species.shroodle.name: Shroodle
cobblemon.species.shroodle.desc: Shroodle is usually quite mellow around those it likes, but it can swiftly turn aggressive, delivering a paralyzing toxic bite to both trainers and Pokémon that get on its bad side. It uses this same poison in its fangs to carve foul-smelling markings around its nest, deterring intruders from approaching.
cobblemon.species.grafaiai.name: Grafaiai
cobblemon.species.grafaiai.desc: Grafaiai covers the trees in its forest home with colorful patterns made from its paint-like toxic saliva, which changes color depending on the berries it consumes as part of its diet. Each individual creates a unique pattern that it continues to paint throughout its life, making its mark on the environment and expressing its individuality.
cobblemon.species.bramblin.name: Bramblin
cobblemon.species.bramblin.desc: A soul unable to move on to the afterlife was blown around by the wind until it got tangled up with dried grass and became a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.brambleghast.name: Brambleghast
cobblemon.species.brambleghast.desc: It will open the branches of its head to envelop its prey. Once it absorbs all the life energy it needs, it expels the prey and discards it.
cobblemon.species.toedscool.name: Toedscool
cobblemon.species.toedscool.desc: Toedscool lives in muggy forests. The flaps that fall from its body are chewy and very delicious.
cobblemon.species.toedscruel.name: Toedscruel
cobblemon.species.toedscruel.desc: These Pokémon gather into groups and form colonies deep within forests. They absolutely hate it when strangers approach.
cobblemon.species.klawf.name: Klawf
cobblemon.species.klawf.desc: Klawf hangs upside-down from cliffs, waiting for prey. But Klawf can't remain in this position for long because its blood rushes to its head.
cobblemon.species.capsakid.name: Capsakid
cobblemon.species.capsakid.desc: The more sunlight this Pokémon bathes in, the more spicy chemicals are produced by its body, and thus the spicier its moves become.
cobblemon.species.scovillain.name: Scovillain
cobblemon.species.scovillain.desc: The red head converts spicy chemicals into fire energy and blasts the surrounding area with a super spicy stream of flame.
cobblemon.species.rellor.name: Rellor
cobblemon.species.rellor.desc: This Pokémon creates a mud ball by mixing sand and dirt with psychic energy. It treasures its mud ball more than its own life.
cobblemon.species.rabsca.name: Rabsca
cobblemon.species.rabsca.desc: The body that supports the ball barely moves. Therefore, it is thought that the true body of this Pokémon is actually inside the ball.
cobblemon.species.flittle.name: Flittle
cobblemon.species.flittle.desc: Flittle's toes levitate about half an inch above the ground because of the psychic power emitted from the frills on the Pokémon's belly.
cobblemon.species.espathra.name: Espathra
cobblemon.species.espathra.desc: It immobilizes opponents by bathing them in psychic power from its large eyes. Despite its appearance, it has a vicious temperament.
cobblemon.species.tinkatink.name: Tinkatink
cobblemon.species.tinkatink.desc: This meek little Pokémon is oftentimes bullied by Pokémon that eat or collect metal. Tinkatink must reconstruct its precious rattle-like hammer over and over again after each time it's been stolen. They often hang out near ruins, as they're not only a good source of ancient scrap metal, but archeologists often forget their tools here, which Tinkatink happily repurpose.
cobblemon.species.tinkatuff.name: Tinkatuff
cobblemon.species.tinkatuff.desc: Finally able to make a hammer worthy of a fight, Tinkatuff sets out on a quest for revenge against those that bullied it as a Tinkatink. It pulverizes Pokémon like Bisharp and Aron, taking scraps of their metal to further enhance its hammer. With every victory, it takes a small trophy. When groups of Tinkatuff gather, they take turns showing off these trophies and their hammers to one another.
cobblemon.species.tinkaton.name: Tinkaton
cobblemon.species.tinkaton.desc: Despite its diminutive stature, Tinkaton swings around its massive hammer with little effort. Estimates show that this massive collage of scrap metal is similar in weight to that of an iron golem, and a direct hit from it is enough to crush deepslate into dust. It uses this hulking weapon to target even the largest of Steel-type Pokémon, which stand no chance against it.
cobblemon.species.wiglett.name: Wiglett
cobblemon.species.wiglett.desc: This Pokémon can pick up the scent of a Veluza just over 65 feet away and will hide itself in the sand.
cobblemon.species.wugtrio.name: Wugtrio
cobblemon.species.wugtrio.desc: It has a vicious temperament, contrary to what its appearance may suggest. It wraps its long bodies around prey, then drags the prey into its den.
cobblemon.species.bombirdier.name: Bombirdier
cobblemon.species.bombirdier.desc: It gathers things up in an apron made from shed feathers added to the Pokémon's chest feathers, then drops those things from high places for fun.
cobblemon.species.finizen.name: Finizen
cobblemon.species.finizen.desc: It likes playing with others of its kind using the water ring on its tail. It uses ultrasonic waves to sense the emotions of other living creatures.
cobblemon.species.palafin.name: Palafin
cobblemon.species.palafin.desc: Its physical capabilities are no different than a Finizen’s, but when its allies are in danger, it transforms and powers itself up.
cobblemon.species.varoom.name: Varoom
cobblemon.species.varoom.desc: It is said that this Pokémon was born when an unknown poison Pokémon entered and inspirited an engine left at a scrap-processing factory.
cobblemon.species.revavroom.name: Revavroom
cobblemon.species.revavroom.desc: It creates a gas out of poison and minerals from rocks. It then detonates the gas in its cylinders— now numbering eight—to generate energy.
cobblemon.species.cyclizar.name: Cyclizar
cobblemon.species.cyclizar.desc: Apparently Cyclizar has been allowing people to ride on its back since ancient times. Depictions of this have been found in 10,000-year-old murals.
cobblemon.species.orthworm.name: Orthworm
cobblemon.species.orthworm.desc: When attacked, this Pokémon will wield the tendrils on its body like fists and pelt the opponent with a storm of punches.
cobblemon.species.glimmet.name: Glimmet
cobblemon.species.glimmet.desc: It absorbs nutrients from cave walls. The petals it wears are made of crystallized poison.
cobblemon.species.glimmora.name: Glimmora
cobblemon.species.glimmora.desc: When this Pokémon detects danger, it will open up its crystalline petals and fire beams from its conical body.
cobblemon.species.greavard.name: Greavard
cobblemon.species.greavard.desc: It is said that a dog Pokémon that died in the wild without ever interacting with a human was reborn as this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.houndstone.name: Houndstone
cobblemon.species.houndstone.desc: Houndstone spends most of its time sleeping in graveyards. Among all the dog Pokémon, this one is most loyal to its master.
cobblemon.species.flamigo.name: Flamigo
cobblemon.species.flamigo.desc: This Pokémon apparently ties the base of its neck into a knot so that the energy stored in its belly does not escape from its beak.
cobblemon.species.cetoddle.name: Cetoddle
cobblemon.species.cetoddle.desc: Cetoddle are awkward and adventurous, often approaching passing travelers out of curiosity. They are also playful, and can be seen tumbling down mountainside, slamming into rocks and trees at high speeds. They don’t seem to mind, however, as their body is covered in a thick coat of protective blubber.
cobblemon.species.cetitan.name: Cetitan
cobblemon.species.cetitan.desc: While traversing the snowy wastes, herds of Cetitan and Cetoddle are at risk of attack from Beartic and other tundra predators. Any Pokémon that menaces the young, however, will be met with a blow from Cetitan’s powerful horns. If it cannot handle a fight on its own, it can call for help using a range of sonorous calls, which echo across mountain peaks and can be heard by other Cetitan a great distance away.
cobblemon.species.veluza.name: Veluza
cobblemon.species.veluza.desc: When Veluza discards unnecessary flesh, its mind becomes honed and its psychic power increases. The spare flesh has a mild but delicious flavor.
cobblemon.species.dondozo.name: Dondozo
cobblemon.species.dondozo.desc: This Pokémon is a glutton, but it's bad at getting food. It teams up with a Tatsugiri to catch prey.
cobblemon.species.tatsugiri.name: Tatsugiri
cobblemon.species.tatsugiri.desc: In this form, Tatsugiri seems to be especially appetizing to bottom dwelling Pokémon like Corphish. However, its appearance is a ruse. Whenever a Pokémon approaches it, Dondozo will burst up from under the sand and swallow it whole. After a day's hunt is over, the two Pokémon split the food they have gathered.
cobblemon.species.annihilape.name: Annihilape
cobblemon.species.annihilape.desc: Its primal rage boiled far beyond its limits, finally allowing Annihilape to realize its dream of breaking free from both its violent passion and limiting mortality. This Pokémon has reached a state of tranquility, and it no longer acts with the anger it once did. Although this doesn't mean that its fury has disappeared entirely. When in the heat of battle, Annihilape can reach deep inside its heart to deliver bone-shattering blows filled with every ounce of boiling hatred that it accumulated in its past life.
cobblemon.species.clodsire.name: Clodsire
cobblemon.species.clodsire.desc: The purple spots on Clodsire's back are actually holes concealing venom-coated spines. While this Pokémon spends most of its time peacefully laying on the reedbed of swamps, if it is stepped on or otherwise threatened, it will unleash its spines to deliver a devestating jab of poison.
cobblemon.species.farigiraf.name: Farigiraf
cobblemon.species.farigiraf.desc: Now that the brain waves from the head and tail are synced up, the psychic power of this Pokémon is 10 times stronger than Girafarig's.
cobblemon.species.dudunsparce.name: Dudunsparce
cobblemon.species.dudunsparce.desc: It drives enemies out of its nest by sucking in enough air to fill its long, narrow lungs, then releasing the air in an intense blast.
cobblemon.species.kingambit.name: Kingambit
cobblemon.species.kingambit.desc: Only a Bisharp that stands above all others in its vast army can evolve into Kingambit.
cobblemon.species.greattusk.name: Great Tusk
cobblemon.species.greattusk.desc: Sightings of this Pokémon have occurred in recent years. The name Great Tusk was taken from a creature listed in a certain book.
cobblemon.species.screamtail.name: Scream Tail
cobblemon.species.screamtail.desc: There has been only one reported sighting of this Pokémon. It resembles a mysterious creature depicted in an old expedition journal.
cobblemon.species.brutebonnet.name: Brute Bonnet
cobblemon.species.brutebonnet.desc: It is possible that the creature listed as Brute Bonnet in a certain book could actually be this Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.fluttermane.name: Flutter Mane
cobblemon.species.fluttermane.desc: This Pokémon has characteristics similar to those of Flutter Mane, a creature mentioned in a certain book.
cobblemon.species.slitherwing.name: Slither Wing
cobblemon.species.slitherwing.desc: This mysterious Pokémon has some similarities to a creature that an old book introduced as Slither Wing.
cobblemon.species.sandyshocks.name: Sandy Shocks
cobblemon.species.sandyshocks.desc: No records exist of this Pokémon being caught. Data is lacking, but the Pokémon's traits match up with a creature shown in an expedition journal.
cobblemon.species.irontreads.name: Iron Treads
cobblemon.species.irontreads.desc: This Pokémon closely resembles a scientific weapon that a paranormal magazine claimed was sent to this planet by aliens.
cobblemon.species.ironbundle.name: Iron Bundle
cobblemon.species.ironbundle.desc: Its shape is similar to a robot featured in a paranormal magazine article. The robot was said to have been created by an ancient civilization.
cobblemon.species.ironhands.name: Iron Hands
cobblemon.species.ironhands.desc: It is very similar to a cyborg covered exclusively by a paranormal magazine. The cyborg was said to be the modified form of a certain athlete.
cobblemon.species.ironjugulis.name: Iron Jugulis
cobblemon.species.ironjugulis.desc: It resembles a certain Pokémon introduced in a paranormal magazine, described as the offspring of a Hydreigon that fell in love with a robot.
cobblemon.species.ironmoth.name: Iron Moth
cobblemon.species.ironmoth.desc: This Pokémon resembles an unknown object described in a paranormal magazine as a UFO sent to observe humanity.
cobblemon.species.ironthorns.name: Iron Thorns
cobblemon.species.ironthorns.desc: It has some similarities to a Pokémon introduced in a dubious magazine as a Tyranitar from one billion years into the future.
cobblemon.species.frigibax.name: Frigibax
cobblemon.species.frigibax.desc: Frigibax absorbs heat through its dorsal fin and converts the heat into ice energy. The higher the temperature, the more energy Frigibax stores.
cobblemon.species.arctibax.name: Arctibax
cobblemon.species.arctibax.desc: Arctibax freezes the air around it, protecting its face with an ice mask and turning its dorsal fin into a blade of ice.
cobblemon.species.baxcalibur.name: Baxcalibur
cobblemon.species.baxcalibur.desc: This Pokémon blasts cryogenic air out from its mouth. This air can instantly freeze even liquid-hot lava.
cobblemon.species.gimmighoul.name: Gimmighoul
cobblemon.species.gimmighoul.desc: These Gimmighoul hide within chests at the top of crumbling towers that have stood since before written history began. Fiercely protective of the treasures they collect, they invite much speculation. Are they loyal guardians of relics left by long-lost trainers, or are they simply bandits content to sit atop their plunder for millenia?
cobblemon.species.gholdengo.name: Gholdengo
cobblemon.species.gholdengo.desc: Upon completing its collection of 1,000 coins, a Gimmighoul will evolve into Gholdengo: a friendly Pokémon with a body comprised almost entirely of golden coins. It is capable of manipulating these coins at will, launching them at excessive speed towards foes and forming surfboards or other objects from them. The sheer amount of gold and rares required to get a Gholdengo is the only thing offsetting the average trainer from commanding its nearly unmatched battle prowess.
cobblemon.species.wochien.name: Wo-Chien
cobblemon.species.wochien.desc: The grudge of a person punished for writing the king's evil deeds upon wooden tablets has clad itself in dead leaves to become a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.chienpao.name: Chien-Pao
cobblemon.species.chienpao.desc: This Pokémon can control 100 tons of fallen snow. It plays around innocently by leaping in and out of avalanches it has caused.
cobblemon.species.tinglu.name: Ting-Lu
cobblemon.species.tinglu.desc: The fear poured into an ancient ritual vessel has clad itself in rocks and dirt to become a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.chiyu.name: Chi-Yu
cobblemon.species.chiyu.desc: It controls flames burning at over 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit. It casually swims through the sea of lava it creates by melting rock and sand.
cobblemon.species.roaringmoon.name: Roaring Moon
cobblemon.species.roaringmoon.desc: It is possible that this is the creature listed as Roaring Moon in an expedition journal that still holds many mysteries.
cobblemon.species.ironvaliant.name: Iron Valiant
cobblemon.species.ironvaliant.desc: It has some similarities to a mad scientist's invention covered in a paranormal magazine.
cobblemon.species.koraidon.name: Koraidon
cobblemon.species.koraidon.desc: This Pokémon resembles Cyclizar, but it is far burlier and more ferocious. Nothing is known about its ecology or other features.
cobblemon.species.miraidon.name: Miraidon
cobblemon.species.miraidon.desc: This seems to be the Iron Serpent mentioned in an old book. The Iron Serpent is said to have turned the land to ash with its lightning.
cobblemon.species.walkingwake.name: Walking Wake
cobblemon.species.walkingwake.desc: It resembles an illustration published in a paranormal magazine, said to be a depiction of a super-ancient Suicune.
cobblemon.species.ironleaves.name: Iron Leaves
cobblemon.species.ironleaves.desc: According to the few eyewitness accounts that exist, it used its shining blades to julienne large trees and boulders.
cobblemon.species.dipplin.name: Dipplin
cobblemon.species.dipplin.desc: Dipplin is two creatures in one Pokémon. Its evolution was triggered by a special apple grown only in one place.
cobblemon.species.poltchageist.name: Poltchageist
cobblemon.species.poltchageist.desc: Supposedly, the regrets of a tea ceremony master who died before perfecting his craft lingered in some matcha and became a Pokémon.
cobblemon.species.sinistcha.name: Sinistcha
cobblemon.species.sinistcha.desc: It pretends to be tea, trying to fool people into drinking it so it can drain their life-force. Its ruse is generally unsuccessful.
cobblemon.species.okidogi.name: Okidogi
cobblemon.species.okidogi.desc: After all its muscles were stimulated by the toxic chain around its neck, Okidogi transformed and gained a powerful physique.
cobblemon.species.munkidori.name: Munkidori
cobblemon.species.munkidori.desc: The chain is made from toxins that enhance capabilities. It stimulated Munkidori's brain and caused the Pokémon's psychic powers to bloom.
cobblemon.species.fezandipiti.name: Fezandipiti
cobblemon.species.fezandipiti.desc: Fezandipiti owes its beautiful looks and lovely voice to the toxic stimulants emanating from the chain wrapped around its body.
cobblemon.species.ogerpon.name: Ogerpon
cobblemon.species.ogerpon.desc: This Pokémon's type changes based on which mask it's wearing. It confounds its enemies with nimble movements and kicks.
cobblemon.species.archaludon.name: Archaludon
cobblemon.species.archaludon.desc: It gathers static electricity from its surroundings. The beams it launches when down on all fours are tremendously powerful.
cobblemon.species.hydrapple.name: Hydrapple
cobblemon.species.hydrapple.desc: Seven syrpents live inside an apple made of syrup. The syrpent in the center is the commander.
cobblemon.species.gougingfire.name: Gouging Fire
cobblemon.species.gougingfire.desc: There are scant few reports of this creature being sighted. One short video shows it rampaging and spouting pillars of flame.
cobblemon.species.ragingbolt.name: Raging Bolt
cobblemon.species.ragingbolt.desc: It's said to incinerate everything around it with lightning launched from its fur. Very little is known about this creature.
cobblemon.species.ironboulder.name: Iron Boulder
cobblemon.species.ironboulder.desc: It was named after a mysterious object recorded in an old book. Its body seems to be metallic.
cobblemon.species.ironcrown.name: Iron Crown
cobblemon.species.ironcrown.desc: There was supposedly an incident in which it launched shining blades to cut everything around it to pieces. Little else is known about it.
cobblemon.species.terapagos.name: Terapagos
cobblemon.species.terapagos.desc: It's thought that this Pokémon lived in ancient Paldea until it got caught in seismic shifts and went extinct.
cobblemon.species.pecharunt.name: Pecharunt
cobblemon.species.pecharunt.desc: Its peach-shaped shell serves as storage for a potent poison. It makes poisonous mochi and serves them to people and Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.adaptability.desc: Powers up moves of the same type as the Pokémon.
cobblemon.ability.aerilate.desc: Normal-type moves become Flying-type moves. The power of those moves is boosted a little.
cobblemon.ability.aftermath.desc: Damages the attacker if it contacts the Pokémon with a finishing hit.
cobblemon.ability.analytic.desc: Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
